In addition she also operates a clothes selling business from which she earns her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and opening a boutique shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to add a stock of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to add a stock of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a businesswoman, and she runs a cosmetics shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Margrette

texts.en: Margrette is a businesswoman, and she sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. To earn extra income she does pig farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Patience is a single woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of theft because of the insecurity of her place of operation.  Her major dream is to expand and open a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en:
Sanubar is a 48-year-old woman who is married with four children. She is market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 11 years of experience and a deep knowledge of market and demand of clients. This shop is only one financial income in her family. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is AZN 250.  He husband helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a loan of AZN 600 to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy and diversify food products

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a patient and hard working mother of three children. She is 46 years old and married to a farmer. Dominga is engaged in making and selling snack foods like pancakes and other foods made from glutinous powder. Dominga also cooks Filipino food for meals like caldareta, adobo and tinola that she sells in their village. She also sells breads; banana and juice drinks for additional income.

Dominga dreams of once again sending her child to college. This child temporarily stopped going to college because of the lack of finances. She is aiming to sell more everyday and earn a higher income to pursue her dreams. Dominga is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy meat, glutinous and ingredients used in cooking foods. She hopes that she can sell more everyday and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy meat and other ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (Sister’s daughter). She sells second hand clothes at the market .She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent .

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, he has operated a farming business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition, he also sells cereals (grains), which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to get produce to the market and unpredictable climatic changes. He dreams of expanding to a large-scale farm in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to purchase two oxen to use in ploughing and to purchase seeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen to use in ploughing and to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Hasanxan

texts.en:
Hasanxan is a 46-year-old married man. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. He has twelve years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demand of clients. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is about 240 AZN.  His wife is a housekeeper and helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in his family. Hasanxan is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, which is in the central bazaar of his home town. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase more food products and to diversify his range of goods to cover customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy and diversify his range of goods.

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en:
Vazifa is a 57-year-old woman, married with four children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods in her shop. She has ten years of experience, which makes her a knowledgeable and skilled person. She sells foodstuff like candies, cookies, butter and macaroni, as well as hair color, perfumes and some cosmetic stuff. 

The products she sells are very popular in Azerbaijan and sold quickly from the shelves. Her business brings her about 120 AZN profit a month. It is hard to keep satisfied customers with this income, because Hafiza needs to make some savings and can’t put all her income back into the business again. This is the only financial source in her family. 

Hafiza needs to expand her business, and for this purpose she applied for a 600 AZN loan. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to buy food products and other merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a café business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing her own shop to let in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Pari

texts.en:
Pari is a 46-year-old woman, married with two children. She raises fruits and vegetables in her garden. She started this business 9 years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. People like to eat them fresh and make fresh juices, which is very healthy. 

Her husband sells Pari's crops in the central bazaar and her monthly income is about 300 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for a woman, and so her father helps Pari. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly turnover.  For this purpose she applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a single woman with five children. Not all of them attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a café business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her cafe in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to operate another line of business, purchasing goats for the sale of goat meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell goat meat, thus starting another business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is single. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this loan from Kiva to buy seeds, spraying and support labor costs to get the best harvest of rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, spraying and labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a woman with six children, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She sells snacks at the market and has been doing so for the past six years. Her other side job is weaving. She aims to open a shop in future. 

Mwanamkasi joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she intends to purchase sugar, wheat flour and charcoal. Her greatest monthly expense is food, and she describes her major challenge to be the high price of commodities.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is taking out another Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to expand her goat business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats to supply to slaughterhouses. With the last loan, she got enough working capital and was able to supply the market. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a slaughterhouse in the future. The loan has helped her family, and she is able to provide for the necessary family needs and live in a permanent family house.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to supply to slaughterhouses.

loans.name: Solnyshko Group

texts.ru:
Турсун – лидер группы «Солнышко», вдова, воспитала 8 детей.  Турсун занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1996 году с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS).  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы и 5 коз и получая прибыль в сумме около 15,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов, Турсун намерена и далее развивать животноводство.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Турсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья. 
Также в состав группу входят две соседки – Индира и Эркингул, обратившиеся в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)каждая на увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Tursun, the leader of the "Solnyshko" group, is a widow and raised eight children.  Tursun is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 1996 with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Having two dairy cows and five goats in her business and making a profit of about 15,000 som per month from sales of milk and milk products, Tursun is determined to continue developing her animal husbandry business.  In order to further develop her business, Tursun requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.
Also included in the group are two neighbors - Indira and Erkingul, who each requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Мукаддас занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья и шторы для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Mukaddas is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 44 years old, married and has three children.  Mukaddas is involved in sewing.  She makes national dresses and drapes for sale.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Точинисо более пяти лет занимается шитьем. Она в основном шьет платья и наволочки. Кредит берет для покупки однотонных тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Tojiniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children.  Tojiniso has been involved in sewing for over five years.  She primarily sews dresses and pillow slips.  She is requesting this loan to buy single-tone fabrics and threads.

loans.use: to purchase single-tone fabrics and threads

loans.name: Xayala

texts.en:
Xayala is a 29-year-old woman who is married with two children. She is a very kind and responsible woman. She raises fruits and vegetables in her garden and has been doing so for the last 3 years. She is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it. A poor financial situation and unemployment have pushed her to start her business. 

Xayala usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and are in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes is dolma, which is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes. Fresh juices are most likely made from fresh fruits. Xayala's monthly income from this business is 250 AZN. This is the only source of income for her family.

Now Xayala would like to invest more capital into her business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. This is the only source of income for her family and she hopes this loan will improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 51 years old and is from Nakuru. She has three children who are in college.

Cicilia has a clothing business that she has been doing for the past 20 years. She is applying for her first loan to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open a boutique shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Kirinkai

texts.en:
Kirinkai is 26 years old, single, and supports a family of six people. He has been doing mixed farming for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of  30,000 KES. 

Kirinkai is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET. He plans to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. He will use the profits to increase his capital base.

His future plans is to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Жура житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жура занимается торговлей тканей у себя дома. Торговлей он занимается уже 30 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тонких и хлопковых тканей.
texts.en: Jura is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 49 years old, married and has two children.  Jura is involved in sales of fabrics at home.  He has been in sales for 30 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy thin and cotton fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase thin and cotton fabrics

loans.name: Ivonne Fabiola

texts.es: La señora Ivonne , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , su esposo labora en una empresa privada para aportar con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tiene un hijo que va a clases y necesita de su apoyo , los planes hacia su familia es poder realizar un cuarto en la parte trasera de la humilde vivienda ya que donde habitan están todos pegaditos por el pequeño  espacio que hay y a la vez no pueden tener privacidad , doña Ivonne , desde hace varios años labora como domestica en una casa privada y por sus misma limitaciones económicas no a logrado realizar sus sueños de aumentar un poco su pequeña vivienda . El préstamo lo quiere para comprar arena, piedra, bloques, cemento, entre otros.
texts.en:
Ivonne lives with her family in the Ticuantepe municipality. Her husband works for a private company in order to contribute to the household expenses.  They have a child who goes to school and needs their support.

The plan for her family is to be able to make a room in the back part of their humble home.  They all live on top of each other because of the small amount of space there is, and there is no privacy. 

Ivonne has worked as a domestic employee in a private house for several years.  Due to their financial limitations she has not been able to fulfill her dream of expanding her house a little bit.

The loan that she wants is to buy sand, gravel, cement blocks, and cement, among others.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 38 años, es casada  con 3 hijos de las edades de  5, 17 y 22 años la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de comida su negocio se encuentran en su mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María utilizara este préstamo  para compra de ollas, vajillas  para la elaboración de sus comidas y también comprar  gaseosas para su venta, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de personal para atención y para ayudarle con la elaboración de los alimentos, Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en la ampliación y mejorar su negocio,  la Sra. María con el tiempo desea  remodelar su vivienda, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: María is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged 5, 17 and 22. María works selling food. Her business is located in her own house. This loan represents her sixth sequence within the institution. María will use this loan to buy pots and dishes to prepare her food, and she will also buy soft drinks to sell. The reason that she is requesting this loan is to increase her working capital. María faces challenges in her business, including a lack of personnel for serving and to help her prepare the foods. She will use the benefits to expand and improve her business. Over time, María wants to remodel her home. María is a very hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en: Nicodemus, 58 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Alice and they have no children. Nicodemus has been a photographer for the past 14 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy another camera to use in his shop. He hopes to own his own studio soon.

loans.use: To buy another camera

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 58 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married and has a 13-year-old son. Elizabeth has been farming for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to  be the best farmer in her area in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 24-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He opened a clothing shop two years ago and his father, also a market vendor, helped to run the business. Kanan's efforts to learn the best skills helps him successfully run the business. 

Kanan sells women's and children's clothes and has very good taste. Rural women like to wear very simple clothes and prefer the same for their children. Kanan tries to satisfy clients' needs and high demand. He is always ready to give discounts to permanent customers. His monthly income is 230 AZN.

Kanan has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more seasonal clothes, especially for summer. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for the upcoming summer season

loans.name: Olmas

texts.ru: Олмас  57 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1995 году Олмас начала   заниматься животноводством.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Олмас имеется 2 бычка, 5 овец и 19 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Олмас обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов коз. Доходы Олмас планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Olmas is 57 years old, married and raised four children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1995.  Today, her business contains two bulls, five sheep and nineteen goats.  In order to further develop her business, Olmas requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of goats.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.ru: Саидбек проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством. В основном Махмадчон выращивает бахчевые культуры и овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Saidbek lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 29 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saidbek is involved in agriculture.  He primarily grows melon crops and vegetables.  He has been in this business for three years.  Saidbek is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián” en la provincia del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por trece personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, venta de muebles de madera, venta de comida y otros brindan servicios.
 
(La socia Sabina está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Sabina nació en la ciudad de Puno pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 27 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Sabina es la produccion y venta de Queso y también tiene una pizzería. En esta oportunidad Sabina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para producir queso. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián” communal bank several years ago.  This communal bank has 13 members who seek opportunities at every moment to get ahead and through their daily efforts provide a better future for their children.  Some examples of the types of commercial activities of the members are: crafts sales, wood furniture sales, food sales and others provide services.

Sabina is raising her hand in the photo.  She was born in the city of Puno but currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She’s 27 years old, married and has three children.  Sabina’s economic activity is making and selling cheese; she also has a pizzeria.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy supplies to make cheese.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in the District and Province of Cusco in Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city.  It’s noted for being a very touristy area because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, for its scenery and its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is noted for being a very touristy, commercial zone, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cheese.

loans.name: Beishenbubu

texts.ru: Бейшенбубу  59 лет, замужем, воспитала 5 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, 20 лет  назад Бейшенбубу начала   заниматься животноводством.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бейшенбубу имеется 2 бычка, 10 овец, дойная корова и телка. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бейшенбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Бейшенбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Beishenbubu is 59 years old, married and raised five children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry 20 years ago.  Today her business contains two bulls, ten sheep and dairy cow and a heifer.  In order to further develop her business, Beishenbubu requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarabu

texts.ru: Сарабу 60 лет,  воспитала двух детей.   В 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Сарабу начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Сарабу сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Сарабу  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Сарабу планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Sarabu is 60 years old, she raised two children. In 2008 while looking for a source of income for her family Sarabu started her business selling groceries with the starting capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Because of her steadfastness and hard work Sarabu was able to develop her business with a monthly profit of 15,000 KGS. Today there's not much variety in her merchandise and that's why she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS. Sarabu plans to invest the income from the loan into growth of her business.

loans.use: to expand variety of goods.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA DULCE” iniciará su decimo primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Vicencia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de mochila, artesanía de alpaca y vicuña, venta de queso, venta de verduras, venta de mantas, venta de víveres a crédito, venta de papa.

La señora Vicencia, indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lanas, misma que los adquirirá de las ferias de El Alto y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Agua Dulce” (Sweet Water) communal bank will start its 11th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has 7 members led by a governing board headed by Vicencia.  The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: backpack making, alpaca and vicuña crafts, cheese sales, vegetables sales, blanket sales, food sales on credit and potato sales.

Vicencia indicates that she’s been a member of a Pro Mujer communal bank for a year having been invited to join by her fellow members.  She currently has a blanket weaving business that she’s had for years; she learned this activity from her mother-in-law.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy wool yarn that she’ll get in the city of El Alto’s street markets and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This business helps her support her family since she has a spouse and a son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the meetings and the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres por un bien común”  están  en el  Primer ciclo  con 17  integrantes , el  grupo  se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas en su  comunidad, ya que hacen obras de caridad ,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso fijo. 
Liduvina es miembro del grupo, y cuenta que tiene una despensita bien surtida, negocio que le ayuda a poder mantener a su familia y darles lo que ellos necesitan para el día a día. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y con gran espíritu emprendedor. 
Su deseo es seguir teniendo bien surtido su negocio, por lo que solicita el préstamo, ya que quiere comprar azúcar, leche, pan, fideos, yerba y demás artículos que son los que más ventas tiene. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Por Un Bien Común are in their first cycle with 17 members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united in their community because they do charity work.  They have different business activities and others are undertaking new work and have a fixed income.

Liduvina is a member of the group.  She has a small, well-stocked grocery store.  This business helps her to be able to support her family and give them what they need day to day.  She is known as a very hard-working person with a great desire to get ahead and a big entrepreneurial spirit.

Her wish is to continue to have a well-stocked business.  That is why she is requesting the loan.  She wants to buy sugar, milk, bread, noodles, “yerba mate” (a popular South American herb that is brewed into a high-caffeine infusion), and other items that sell the most.

They are all grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, bread, noodles, “yerba mate” (a popular South American herb that is brewed into a high-caffeine infusion), and other items.

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: Боймурод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Он женат. Ему 44 года. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе, жена занимается торговлей на рынке. Сам Боймурод более 20 лет занимается скотоводством. Также в свободное время он занимается перевозками и предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Boymurod lives in the Gissar district.  He is 44 years old, married and has three children.  His children attend a secondary school, and wife is involved in sales at a market.  Boymurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years.  He is also involved in transportation and providing a taxi service in his free time.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер проживает в Гиссарском районе. Он женат. Ему 50 лет. У него четверо детей. Алишер имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он товаровед. Уже десять лет как Алишер занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. Кредит берет для покупки колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Gissar district.  He is 50 years old, married and has four children.  Alisher has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a merchandiser.  Alisher has been involved in sales for ten years.  He has a food market, where he works as a salesperson.  He is requesting this loan to buy sausages.

loans.use: to buy sausages

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel es un joven de 20 años es el hermano mayor de 4 hermanos, es un joven muy responsable ya que desde los 16 años trabaja en la actividad  de su padre que es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual ha dejado de estudiar, Luis Miguel vive con los padres en la comunidad del Abra de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su principal actividad es el servicio transporte de pasajeros, cuenta con un minibús que  pertenece a un sindicato de transporte público.  El destino del crédito es para la reposición de compra de otro vehículo, ya que le falto dinero, dicho vehículo  trabajara como taxi con un chofer, con lo incrementara sus ingresos.
Entre sus sueños y metas es apoyar a sus hermanos para que sigan estudiando hasta verlos con una carrera profesional ya que él no ha logrado estudiar ni hasta el bachillerato y construir su propia casa ya que cuentan con un terreno que le heredaron sus padres en gratificación a los años que se ha pasado ayudándolos.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel, 20, is a young man who is the oldest of four siblings.  He’s a very responsible young man who has worked in his father’s activity which is passenger transportation service since he was 16 years old.  To do so, he stopped attending school.  Luis Miguel lives with his parents in the community of Abra in the city of Cochabamba.  

His main activity is passenger transportation service.  He has a minibus that belongs to a public transportation syndicate.  The loan will be used to complete the amount he needs to buy another vehicle because he’s short on the amount he needs.  Said vehicle will be put to work as a taxi with a driver which will increase his income.

Among his dreams and goals is to support his siblings so that they will stay in school and obtain professional careers since he wasn’t even able to get to high school and to build a house of his own since he has a piece of land inherited from their parents as compensation for all the years he’s been helping them.

loans.use: to complete amount needed to buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Lidia Inocencia

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia tiene 30 años y es soltera con 1 hijo de la edad de 7 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares, su negocio es en su  mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Lidia utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de accesorios para celulares por mayor para surtir su negocio, La razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra.  Lidia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que estos últimos tiempos se incremento la venta de celulares, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar su casa y seguir creciendo en su negocio,  la Sra. Lidia es una persona joven y emprendedora con ganas de superación ya que desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Lidia is 30 years old, single and has a 7 year old son.  She sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories.  Her business is located at home.  This loan is her fifth sequence in the institution.  Lidia will use this loan to buy mobile phone accessories at wholesale to stock her business.  The reason for requesting this loan is to increase working capital.  

The business challenge Lidia faces is competition because the sale of mobile phones has increased lately.  She will use profits to improve her house and continue growing in her business.  Lidia is a young, enterprising person with a strong desire to improve because she wants a better quality of life for her entire family.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories at wholesale.

loans.name: Nairurari

texts.en:
Nairurari is 37 years old and blessed with seven children. She has been a livestock trader for the past four years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Nairurari has borrowed her  first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost the business and repay her loan. Nairurari's future dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all in school. Juliet also takes care of additional family members (sister).

Juliet has operated a retail shop for the last 2 years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, rice, flour and sugar. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Juliet's goals and hopes are to buy a wholesaler and a plot of land.

Juliet lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Juliet's monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 56 years old, is married and has six children, all in school. The family lives in Nakuru.

James has been farming for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seedlings for planting this season. James hopes to do large scale farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Elisabeth  fait partie du groupe Turamirize et habite à Gitega. Elle a  32 ans et est mariée à Celestin,un commerçant.  Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants,dont  3 étudient, à l’école primaire.

Elle fait le commerce de boissons depuis 7ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et introduire dans son commerce un nouveau produit ,le café,pour gagner plus.

Les gains du commerce, lui permet de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a member of the Turamirize group and lives in Gitega.  She is 32 years old and married to Celestin, a merchant.  They have five children together, three of whom are in primary school.

She has been selling drinks for the last seven years.  She is on her tenth loan with Turame.  With the Kiva credit she obtains, she will increase her business capital and add a new product, coffee, to her market in order to earn more.

Her business income allows her to pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy new products to resell.

loans.name: Jannatkan

texts.ru:
Жаннаткан 52 года. В 1978 году, после замужества, в поисках дохода,  Жаннаткан начала заниматься животноводством, начав с двух дойных коров, подаренных родителями на свадьбу.  В настоящее время в хозяйстве Жаннаткан имеется  6 дойных коров, 6 овец, приносящих около 15,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаннаткан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жаннаткан планирует частично вложить в организацию отдыха для своей семьи на горном озере Иссык-Кул, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Jannatkan is 52 years old.  After getting married, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1978, starting with two dairy cows given to her as wedding gifts by her parents.  At the present time, Jannatkan's business contains six dairy cows and six sheep, and yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Jannatkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan partially into organizing a vacation for her family at a mountain lake Issyk-Kul and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona emprendedora, comerciante su negocio consiste en venta de articulos ferreteros, es atraves de sus ventas el medio de ganarse la vida y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con el prestamo anterior cambio el techo de su hogar, siendo de gran beneficio ya que para el tiempo de lluvia no se le pasa el agua. Sus planes es construir por completo su vivienda. Con este nuevo ciclo de credito comprara materiales para los conductos de aguas negras e instalacion de servicio higienico. Para cumplir este proyecto nuevo necesita la compra de los siguientes materiales: cemento, tuberías pvc, arena, hierro, golosa, laminas de zinc angulares, cajorold, codos, pegamentos,hinodro, puerta entre otros materiales. Con estas mejoras lograra alejar las enfermedades y obtener mejor higiene. Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por el continuo apoyo al mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Petrona is an entrepreneur and business owner. Her business is selling hardware items. Through her sales she earns a living and provides her family with better living conditions.

With the earlier loan, she replaced the roof of her home, which is very beneficial, as in the rainy season, the water doesn't get in. Her plans are to finish building her house. With this new loan, she will buy materials for the wastewater pipes and installation of a bathroom. 

To carry out this project, she needs to buy the following materials: cement, PVC pipe, sand, iron, metal screws, zinc metal sheeting, elbows, adhesives, a toilet, a door and other things. With these improvements she will succeed in keeping illnesses away and having better hygiene.  

She is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for their continuing support with the improvement of her home.

loans.use: To install wastewater pipes and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Rafael, está casado con la Sra. Eulalia, tienen 6 hijos, todos ya mayores y que no dependen más de ambos.
Rafael tiene una despensa donde se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo, a lo que se dedica hace ya 8 años, el comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias a sus ahorro que venía juntando de otros trabajos que realizaba anteriormente. Su negocio fue montado con las ganancias que obtenía de las ventas de productos, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante.
El solicita el crédito para abastecer su despensa con productos de primera necesidad, como ser fideos, arroz, harina, bebidas y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Rafael is married to Eulalia; they have six children who are all adults now and no longer dependent on them.  Rafael has a store where he sells all kinds of products; he’s been in this business 8 years already.  He started to work independently thanks to the savings he’d been setting aside from other jobs he used to have.  He set up the store with profits he’d get selling products in an ambulatory way.

He’s asking for a loan to stock his store with basic staple items like noodles, rice, flour, soft-drinks and others.  He is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity he’s being granted.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, flour, soft-drinks and others.

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es: El señor Armando jose, de 43 años de edad, casado es un señor con deseos de superacion en todas las areas de su vida. Asegura que el apoyo brindado por su señora esposa le ha sido fundamental para llegar a lograr todo lo que el se ha propuesto. Juntos es como han podido avanzar hasta llegar al fin deseado el cual es comenzar hacerle mejoras a su vivienda. En esta ocasión el credito solicitado lo requerira para la construccion de un cuarto. Para llevar a cabo dicho plan hara usos de los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrin, estribos, alambre de amarre entre otros; mediante el mismo obtendra privacidad para su matrimonio. Sus poyectos a futuro es instalar una distribuidora de repuestos de motos, negocio que le sea mas rentable y por ende le genere mejores condiciones de vida para su pequeño hijo de apenas un año de edad y su señora esposa.Agradece la confianza que le brinda Kiva y Afodenic para realizar sus sueños y disfrutar de una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Armando José, 43, is a married man with hopes of improving in all areas of his life.  He insists that the support he’s had from his wife has been fundamental for him attaining everything he’s set out to.  Together is how they’ve been able to advance until they’ve reached their desired end which is to start to do some home improvements.

On this occasion, he needs the requested loan to build a room.  To carry out this plan he will need the following materials: cement, sand, rebar, concrete blocks, gravel, braces and tie wire, among others so that he can attain privacy for his marriage.  

His future plan is to open a motorcycle spare parts shop, a more profitable business that will generate better living conditions for his little son who is barely a year old and for his wife.  He is grateful for the trust Kiva and Afodenic place in him so that he can reach his dreams and enjoy more comfort.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a room.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a widow with seven children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, Rehema has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is high transportation costs. Rehema dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. She plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sacks of sugar and wheat flour. Rehema decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru:
Гулзат  36 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В 2009 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Гулзат начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 25,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулзат на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 дойные коровы, 20 голов овец, 10 голов коз и 4 головы лошади. Доходы от продажи молочных продуктов составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства посредством посадки картофеля на земле мерою 0,5 га .
texts.en: Gulzat is 36 years old, married and raising four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Gulzat became involved in animal husbandry in 2009, with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains four dairy cows, twenty sheep, ten goats and four horses.  The earnings from sales of milk products amount to about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Gulzat requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a future expansion of her business by planting potatoes on approximately 0.5 hectares of land.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Villa Conavu Group

texts.es:
Villa Conavi es el grupo integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son conocidas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo en conjunto ayudarse y también de esa forma ayudar a sus familias. 
Fidelina es integrante del grupo. Ella tiene una verdulería donde vende todo tipo de verduras y hortalizas con la cual abastece a su vecindario. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo y su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma ir creciendo y ayudando a su familia. 
Viene a la fundación y a Kiva para pedir un préstamo para que pueda invertirlo en la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, lechugas y demás verduras y hortalizas para poder surtir su
texts.en:
“Villa Conavi” is a group composed of 10 women from the city of Santaní.  They are acquaintances and neighbors from that city.  They joined together in order to help each other and through their teamwork help each other out and also help their families this way.

Fidelina is a group member.  She has a fruit and vegetable shop where she sells all types of vegetables and greens supplying her neighborhood.  She comments that thanks to her work and effort she’s been able to get ahead and to grow this way while helping her family.

She comes to the Fundación and to Kiva to ask for a loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, lettuce and other vegetables and greens to stock up.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, lettuce and other vegetables and greens.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque es el grupo que está integrado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que día a día luchan por un futuro mejor para ellas y para sus familias. Es un grupo muy unido y trabajador, que desea ir progresando y llegar al máximo nivel del programa de la fundación paraguaya. 
Nelida es lavandera, comenta que siempre esta atareada y con mucho trabajo. Es una persona muy sacrificada y que se esfuerza mucho día a día. Comenta que lava ropa de muchas personas, gracias a esto puede tener el dinero que necesita para poder mantener a su familia y de esa forma tratar de darles para el día a día. 
Nelida quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y por ello solicita el crédito, ya que quiere comprar jabones, detergentes, suavizantes y desodorantes para ropas, para que de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
“San Roque” is a group composed of 13 women from the city of Caacupé.  They are female heads of household who strive daily for a better future for themselves and for their families.  It’s a very united, hardworking group that wants to make progress and reach the top level of Fundación Paraguaya’s program.

Nélida is a laundress.  She comments that she’s always very busy with much work to do. She is a very self-sacrificing person who strives much every day.  She comments that she washes clothes for many people and thanks to this is able to have the money she needs to support her family and try to provide for their day to day needs.

Nélida wants to continue investing in her business and this is why she’s asking for the loan because she wants to buy soap, detergent, fabric softener and clothes deodorant to continue working.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, fabric softeners and clothes deodorant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Nyota, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur talentueux, âgée de 42 ans. Elle fait l'artisanat. Elle vend également de braises, pétroles, etc. Son mari est agent au centre pour handicap. Elle a été initiée par ses pairs. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  15eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses œuvres d’arts consommées par ses clients. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter les inputs de production. Ses difficultés sont souvent la rupture de matières premières. La cliente  souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The client, a member of the Nyota credit group, is a dynamic, talented entrepreneur.  She is 42 years old and makes handcrafts.  She also sells charcoal, gasoline, etc.  Her husband is an agent at a center for the disabled.  She was introduced to the group by peers and later learned about the microcredit available through Hekima.  She then took out her first loan of $50 to strengthen her business.  The money she makes in her business goes toward savings, food, and her children's education.  She is now on her 15th loan.  Over this period, she has sold her artworks to clients, and has decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle.  This new loan will allow her to buy materials.  Her difficulty in her business is breakage of materials.  She wishes to see her children grow up and to buy a piece of land in the future.  She thanks Hekima for helping low-income women gain autonomy.

loans.use: to buy materials for handcrafts.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kamila

texts.ru:
Камиле 23 года. Совместно с родителями, Камила активно развивает фермерское хозяйство. На сегодня,  в хозяйстве Камилы имеется  2 дойные коровы и 1 теленок, доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Камила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп 4 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Камила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Kamila is 23 years old.  Together with her parents, she is actively developing a farming business.  Today, Kamila's business contains two dairy cows and one calf.  The earnings from sales of milk and milk products amount to about 16,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Kamila requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy four bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La Sra. Saturnina  tiene 58 años y es casada con hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la  venta de fruta su puesto de venta se encuentran ubicado en la zona 16 de julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Saturnina utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de fruta por mayor,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Saturnina   enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ampliar su negocio y utilizara los beneficios reinvirtiendo el dinero. La Sra. Saturnina es una persona muy trabajadora y muy amable se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Saturnina is 58 years old and married, with children who are already independent. She works selling fruit. Her sales stand is located in the "16 de Julio" [July 16] neighborhood. This loan represents her first cycle within the institution. Saturnina will use this loan to buy fruit on a wholesale basis. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her working capital. The challenge Saturnina faces is expanding her business. As she uses the benefits, she will reinvest the money she earns. Saturnina is a very hard-working and very likable person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy fruit on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират  43 года,вдова и на воспитании имеет двоих детей.Она очень пунктуальная и расчетливая,также умная женщина. Уже 8 лет она занимается продажей мужских одежд.Когда её мужа не стало она начала работать вдвое, дочку выдала замуж а сын помогает ей по бизнесу.С 2010 года она кредитуется в нашей организации и показала себя с хорошей стороны. В бизнесе у нее много клиентов. На полученный кредит она хочет расширить ассортимент товаров.Она благодарна нашей организации.
texts.en: Makhfirat is 43 years old, a widow and raising two children.  She is a very punctual, calculated and smart woman.  She has been involved in selling men's clothing at a market for eight years.  When her husband passed away, she started working twice as much and married off her daughter.  Her son helps her with the business.  Makhfirat has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2010 and showed herself from a good side.  She has many customers in her business.  Makhfirat wants to use this loan to expand the selection of merchandise.  She is grateful to our organization.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for resale

loans.name: Onolkan

texts.ru:
Онолкан 65 лет, вдова. В  1975 году , в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Онолкан начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве со стартовой суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня,  в хозяйстве Онолкан имеется  1 дойная корова и 10 голов овец ,доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Онолкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Онолкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Onolkan is 65 years old and a widow.  In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1975 with an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS).  Today Onolkan's business contains one dairy cow and ten sheep. and the earnings from sales of milk and milk products yield about 4,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Onolkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nounagnon Félicien

texts.fr: Nounagnon Félicien est âgé de 50 ans et vit au Bénin. Nounagnon Félicien est marié à Victoire.  Nounagnon Félicien n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a douze enfants à leur charge, dont dix constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Nounagnon Félicien et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Nounagnon Félicien exerce le métier de ferraillage depuis cinq ans environs sur des chantiers. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.  Nounagnon Félicien désire mieux renforcer son activité; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Nounagnon Félicien sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement  ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nounagnon Félicien, age 50, lives in Benin and never attended school.  He is married to Victoire.  The couple has twelve children in their care, ten of whom are their own children.  All the children attend school.  Nounagnon Félicien and his wife take care of the various household expenses together.  

In order to cover his various expenses, Nounagnon Félicien has been working as a metal scrap dealer for about five years.  He works on building sites.  This activity allows him to meet the needs of his children as well as his.  He would like to strengthen his activity, in order to efficiently meet his customers' demand.

For this reason, Nounagnon Félicien is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  His previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hammers, pincers, shears etc..

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким- молодой,энергичный парень,мастер на все руки.У него сезонная работа:весной он арендует авто-мойку и нанимает работников, а сам занимается ремонтом квартир по европейскому стилю.Он научился своему делу и уже имеет свою рабочую бригаду.Зимой водит такси.С февраля прошлого года он кредитуется у нас и свой первый кредит использовал на ремонт своего автомобиля.Очередной кредит запрашивает на ремонт автомойки где уже началась работа.Муким хочет улучшить условия работы для клиентов и обстановку на месте деятельности.
texts.en: Mukim is a young and energetic young man, a master of all trades.  He has seasonal work: he leases a car wash during spring and hires workers, but is himself involved in making repairs to apartments to European specifications.  He learned his business and has his own work team.  In the winter, he drives a taxi.  He has been obtaining financing from us since February of last year and used his first loan to repair his car.  He is requesting his next loan to repair his car wash, where the work has already started.  Mukim wants to improve working conditions for his customers and environment at his place of business.

loans.use: to repair his place of business

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират – 24 года, разведена, имеет 2 детей. Занимается торговлей обуви (в зимний период продаёт галоши, тапочки, а в летний - резиновые тапочки). Опыт в этой сфере – 6 лет. Махфират получает алименты на детей, но этого недостаточно одинокой женщине.  Её занятие является основным доходом для семьи. Она хочет накопить денег, чтобы дети ни в чем не нуждались и дать хорошее им образование. С каждого дохода она откладывает необходимую сумму. На полученный кредит планирует увеличить свой товарооборот, закупить сезонную обувь. Махфират выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Makhfirat is 24 years old, divorced and has two children.  She is involved in selling shoes (in the winter, she sells galoshes and slippers, and in the summer - rubber slippers).  She has six years of experience in this business.  Makhfirat receives alimony for the children, but it is not enough for a single woman.  Her business provides the primary source of income for the family.  She wants to save money, so that her children would never be in need for anything and could get a good education.  She sets aside a necessary amount from each earning.  She plans to increase her goods turnover with this loan and buy seasonal shoes.  Makhfirat expresses her gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a seasonal selection of shoes

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru:
Саламат 60 лет. В  1990 году , в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Саламат начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве со стартовой суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня,  в хозяйстве Саламат имеется  2 дойные коровы и 7 голов овец ,доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Salamat is 60 years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1990 with an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS).  Today Salamat's business contains two dairy cows and seven sheep, and the earnings from sales of milk and milk products yield about 4,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Salamat requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sossou Moussiliou

texts.fr: Sossou Moussiliou est âgé de 36 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Adidjatou. Le couple a douze enfants à charge, dont dix sont les leurs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Sossou Moussiliou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Sossou Moussiliou mène comme activité, la vente de sable lagunaire à son domicile. Sossou Moussiliou s'approvisionne au  Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Sossou Moussiliou  sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Sossou Moussiliou is 36 years old and married to a reseller named Adidjatou.  The couple has twelve children in their care, ten of whom are their own children.  Some of the children go to school.  Sossou Moussiliou lives with his wife and children and takes care of the various family expenses.

Sossou Moussiliou has been selling lagoon sand, from his home, for about fifteen years.  He buys his merchandise in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover, Sossou Moussiliou is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  His first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy lagoon sand.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Este comité originó a través de promociones  que se realizaron en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, todas ellas amigas y vecinas, que vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso. El objetivo de ellas es trabajar en forma conjunta, fomentar el espíritu solidario y consolidar el grupo. 
La Sra. Celia es miembro del grupo y nos cuenta que trabaja desde muy temprano en su despensa, atendiendo a los clientes y también cargando los productos que tiene. Nos comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo, sacrificio y trabajo ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando su negocio. 
Ella se acerca hasta la fundación para pedir una ayuda, ya que quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, enlatados, verduras, hortalizas y demás, con lo cual podrá dar una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank originated from promotions that were made in the neighborhood.  All of the members are from the same zone, and they are all friends and neighbors.  They saw a great opportunity for progress in the Fundación Paraguaya’s program. Their objective is to work together, to promote a unified spirit, and to strengthen the group.

Celia is a member of the group.  She tells us that she starts work in her grocery store very early.  She tends to the customers, and she also arranges the products that she has.  She tells us that she started with a little business.  However, thanks to her effort, sacrifice, and work she has been able to grow and improve her business.

She comes to the Fundación to ask for some help.  She wants a loan to buy groceries, drinks, canned goods, vegetables, and more.  With this purchase she will be able to give her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, canned goods, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Zapha

texts.en:
Zapha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a retail shop. She sells her products on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

Zapha has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to open up another retail shop and also educate her child up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, rice, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking flour and cereals.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed woman with five children, none of whom attends school. She sells snacks both from home and at the market. She has been in this business for the past seven years and aspires to open a café in the future. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and describes her greatest monthly expense to be food.

Asha intends to use the Ksh. 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil. Seasonality is her major challenge, especially during the rainy season. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mahougnon Jean

texts.fr: Mahougnon Jean est âgé de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahougnon Jean est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Sévérine.  Mahougnon Jean a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Mahougnon Jean et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Mahougnon Jean exerce le métier de coiffure depuis dix ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Mahougnon Jean vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et du charbon de bois. Mahougnon Jean désire mieux équiper son atelier de coiffure et accroître dans le même temps le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Mahougnon Jean sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahougnon Jean is 29 years old and lives in Benin.  He is married to a hairdresser named Sévérine.   Having left school at the elementary level, he then learned to become a hairdresser.   Mahougnon Jean and Sévérine have three children, some of whom are attending school.  Besides their own children, the couple also has another child in their care.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

In order to take care of his various expenses, Mahougnon Jean has been working as a hairdresser for about ten years.  This activity allows him to provide for his children and for himself.  Additionally, he also sells mobile phone recharge cards and charcoal.

Mahougnon Jean would like to better equip his hair salon and, at the same time, to increase his stock of products, so that he can efficiently respond to his customers' demand.  This is why he is requesting a fourth loan from  ALIDé.  His previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair salon supplies, charcoal and mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Dopoi

texts.en:
Dopoi is 28 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He has practiced mixed farming for the past six years. His monthly income is KES 40,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to add more sheep and cows for fattening. 

His future plan is financial stability and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and medical bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the roadside to passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Jumwa dreams of expanding her business and establishing a stall to sell in town. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling charcoal at the roadside to passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a charcoal stall in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud owns a hair salon. He started his business in 2011. He needs to buy new furniture, which will increase the number of customers, leading to increased profit and income.

Mahmoud is 18 years old, and he is from Gaza. His primary goals for the future are to start a family and provide well for them.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his salon.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 62-year-old Ibrahim. He is married to a trader, and has three children, ages 35, 27 and 15 years old. He has two additional dependents. Five years ago, Ibrahim established his bread baking and provision shop. He started the business because he did not have the opportunity to go to school, so he decided to engage himself in doing business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le3, 000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid the first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy ten bags flour at Le 190,000, provision items at Le 1,000,000, and then he will use the balance for transport. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 906,640.  In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand his bakery.   He is appreciative of the support given to him.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of flour and provision items, and use the balance for transport.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 47-year-old taxi driver in Mombasa. He has been operating this business for the past five years with great success. He is a married father of three school-going children.

This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to pay his children’s school fees. He hopes to have a successful family and well educated children.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina 
2012-47
250000
	Adelina tiene 56 años, vive en Puntarenas, ciudad ubicada en la costa del Pacífico de Costa Rica, ella es viuda y madre de 2 hijos de los cuales 1 es menor de edad. Ella funda hace 4 años un Centro de Reciclaje en su casa, obteniendo su materia prima de Instituciones Públicas de la zona y vendiéndola a 2 empresas en el Valle Central, principalmente Cartón, vidrio y papel.
         La clienta  es una mujer discapacitada, sufrió poliomielitis de joven y además hace 2 años sufrió un accidente de tránsito razón por la cual tiene una silla de ruedas, en no muy buenas condiciones.  En el centro de reciclaje genera empleo y es apoyado por empresas en la zona.
	Su mayor sueño es contar con un centro de reciclaje bien acondicionado y poder brindar apoyo a otras personas con discapacidad, que son marginadas o no encuentran empleo para apoyar económicamente a sus familias. Ella es una líder en la comunidad y está buscando, por medio de una empresa privada, la apertura de un centro de fotocopiado, cerca del Hospital Monseñor Sanabria de Puntarenas.
texts.en:
Adelina is 56 years old and lives in Puntarenas, a city located on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica.  She is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is a minor.  Adelina established a recycling center in her home four years ago.  She obtains raw materials from public institutions in the district and then sells them to two companies in Valle Central.  Mostly she sells cardboard, glass, and paper.  

Adelina is a disabled woman who suffered from polio when she was a young person.  She was also in a traffic accident two years ago, which explains why she has a wheelchair that is not in good condition.  Her recycling center provides jobs and is supported by local companies.  Her greatest wish is to have a recycling center that is well-equipped and to be able to help other people with disabilities who are marginalized and lack jobs to support their families financially.  Adelina is a leader in her community.  With the help of a private company, she plans to open a photocopying center near the Monseñor Sanabria Hospital in Puntarenas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her recycling facility.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, macron, soap, cooking oil, tomato paste and many others for resale.

loans.name: Maria Celendra

texts.es:
Señora María vive en la zona de la Maica Sud  parada 9 1/5 , ella tiene 31 años de edad estudio solo técnico en veterinaria, tiene un niño de cinco años de edad es madre soltera se dedica a la producción de leche tiene dieciséis cabezas de ganado lechero que tiene una producción de 175 litros diarios que los entrega a una persona de la zona que realiza quesillos.
