loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, healthcare, and clothing.

For the past the two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing products. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is forty-two years old, married to Catherine, and blessed with five children aged eighteen, sixteen, fourteen, eleven and eight. He is a farmer, a practice he ventured into four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The profit he makes will help him repay his loan and expand his business. 

His dream is to be successful in the future. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a fifty-one-year-old man with five children, none of whom is enrolled in school. He has been selling fruits at the market for the last three years. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His major challenge is high transportation costs, and he spends a lot on food during the month.

He intends to use the KES 20000 to expand his business by buying mangoes, oranges, and coconuts. Francis joined Yehu to get loans for his business. He aspires to be a prominent business man in the area.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying mangoes, oranges, and coconuts.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is thirty-three years of age. She has been blessed with two school-age children. Her big dream is to provide them with a good education so one day they can have a good employment. Arlene and her spouse help each other to provide for the needs of her children. Currently, Arlene has a small variety store in their house as a source of income.

She wants to add to the stock in her store in order to provide her clientele with a variety of goods to choose. As a result, Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, candies, milk and shampoo. She is hoping that her request for a loan will be approved in order to enhance her profit.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, milk and shampoo.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a nursery school for the kindergarten kids. She dreams of expanding the school to accommodate more children in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chairs for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for the school.

loans.name: Meguelito

texts.en:
Meguelito is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Meguelito is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Meguelito has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Orpah

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Orpah is married and blessed with a ten-year-old son whom she supports. She sells fish, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase more fish for sale. The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a fifty-four-year-old married woman with two children, none of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Susan has been selling fruits for the last three years, and describes poor transport infrastructure as the major challenge. 

She intends to use the KES 25,000 to add an additional stock of fruit to her business. She sells her fruits both from home and at the market. Susan joined Yehu to access cheap loans, and her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to add an additional stock of fruit to her business.

loans.name: Kevins

texts.en:
Kevins is twenty-seven years old, single, and with no dependents. He owns a wholesale stall selling tomatoes in Kitale main market. He started this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase additional crates of tomatoes to sell. The anticipated profit will help him start farming tomatoes in addition to buying and selling. 

He dreams of buying a lorry to ferry his goods to the market rather than hiring vehicles for transportation. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Carmilita

texts.en:
Carmilita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Carmilita has a shop that sells/retails fuel gas. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy plenty of fuel gas to sell.

Carmilita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy plenty of gas to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Activas" esta en el 1º ciclo, surgió gracias a promociones que se hicieron en el barrio. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y con gran espíritu de lucha y emprendedurismo. Su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa. 
La Sra. Eladia, es la Presidenta del grupo, ella orienta a sus compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos mediante la buena utilización del crédito. Ella es peluquera y también repostera, nos comenta que siempre está con muchos pedidos de todos sus clientes, y que gracias a Dios, el trabajo no le falta. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, spray y demás insumos que pueda necesitar para poder seguir trabajando. Ella y su grupo están muy contentas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) committee is in its first cycle.  It arose thanks to promotional activities in their neighborhood.  They are very hardworking people with great fighting and enterprising spirits.  Their goal is to reach the program’s highest level.

Eladia is group president.  She guides her fellow members to strive towards their objectives by managing their credit well.  She is a barber and also a pastry chef.  She comments that she always has many customer orders and thanks be to God she always has work.

She requested the loan to buy shampoo, rinse, hair coloring, spray and other supplies she may need to be able to continue working.  She and her group are very happy for the opportunity they are getting from Kiva and from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo y unido, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 8º, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, sustentos de sus casas. Ellas luchan arduamente por sus hijos y sus familiares, para darles lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación. 
La Sra. Irene  es miembro del grupo,  ella tiene una fábrica de jabones en donde ella misma los fabrica en compañía de su marido y sus hijos que siempre estuvieron con ella en todo y gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto va creciendo con su esfuerzo y también gracias a la  Fundación Paraguaya. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que glicerina, aromatizantes, colorantes y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir elaborando los jabones que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This committee is a very active, united group that’s in its 8th cycle.  They are female heads of household who are the sole support of their homes.  They strive hard for their children and families to give them what they need so that they won’t lack anything.

Irene is a group member.  She has a soap factory where she herself manufactures it with her husband and children who have always been with her in everything.  Because of the time she’s been in this she’s been growing thanks to her efforts and also thanks to Fundación Paraguaya.

She requested the loan to buy ingredients like glycerin, scents, dyes and other supplies needed to continue making the soaps she sells.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy glycerin, scents, dyes and other supplies.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is 53 years old, and is married to Petrocinia who takes care of their six children. They live in the village of Cutog Grande. The primary source of income for the family comes from raising hogs. Domingo has been engaged in his business for many years and earns about PHP 7,000 per hog when it is disposed. Domingo is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and an additional hog to raise. He hopes to grow his business and earn more profits to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
This is Blandina, forty-six, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Renerio, her business partner, and she is a mother of two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Blandina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories and others of the like. Aside from this she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Blandina hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business; she also hopes that they serve the lord. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her business.

Presentacion has been in this business for four years. Presentacion earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and has three children. She is 44 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosa is a farmer and owns a rubber plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 26 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase materials needed for her rubber plantation.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her land to plant more rubber.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her rubber plantation.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 42 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Regina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, eggs, etc.

In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf, used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

She has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is fifty-nine years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Esperanza works very hard to provide for them.

Esperanza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, noodles, eggs, snack foods, etc.

In the future Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged twenty-seven and married with three children aged between six and one. He has been meeting his family's daily needs from the income he makes from farming and by selling produce like milk, maize, beans and poultry. He gets additional income from livestock trade.

Kenedy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry farming by buying more birds. He also hopes to get into the dairy breeding business in five years time. He adds that his focus is to make farming his core business and to be able to educate his children to higher levels.

He mentions fluctuation in market prices and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Vecitacion

texts.en:
Vecitacion is sixty-three years old and widowed with seven children.

Vecitacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vecitacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Vecitacion has been hog-raising for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vecitacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Kuña Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Kuña oñondivepa se llama el grupo integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda para ellas y para sus hijos y familiares. 
Lidia se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser prendas nuevas y usadas. Comenta que gracias a este negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles para poder sobrellevar el día a día.  Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Ellas agradecen a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Kuña Oñondivepa” is the name of this group of 14 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They are female heads of household who see in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women’s program a great help for them and for their children and families.

Lidia works selling all types of clothes both new and used.  She comments that thanks to this business she’s been able to help her family and give them what they need to survive each day.  She defines herself as a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and continue helping her family.

She requests the loan to buy all types of clothes to continue working and offering more variety to her customers.  

They all are grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es una mujer de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, en el sector de Santa Rosa alta que pertenece al distrito de Cayalti que está ubicado a 45 minutos aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en este distrito es muy común que las personas trabajen en la agricultura.

Aurora se dedica hace 15 años a la crianza y venta  de aves de corral, actividad  que aprendió de sus padres, ella cría los animales en la parte trasera de su domicilio, ella los alimenta y engorda ya cuando adquieren un tamaño y peso adecuado los ofrece a la venta a las personas que llegan a la zona.

El préstamo que solicitó Aurora es de S/. 1,000.00 para adquirir más animales y así poder incrementar su negocio logrando un mayor margen de ganancias,  lo que le va a permitir ayudar al tratamiento de su menor hija. Aurora tiene buenas referencias en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Aurora is a 50 year old woman living with her husband and two children in Santa Rosa Alta sector that belongs to Cayalti District and is located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  It’s very common for people in this district to work in agriculture.

Aurora has been raising barnyard fowl to sell for fifteen years.  She learned this activity from her parents.  She raises the animals in her back yard.  She feeds them and fattens them up and when they reach adequate size and weight she sell them to people who come to the zone.

Aurora asked for a 1000 sol loan to buy more animals to increase her business to earn higher profits which will help her for her youngest daughter’s treatment.  Aurora has good references in the zone where she lives.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 33 years old.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lorna has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Paulina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Paulina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité San Roque está integrado por diez mujeres muy emprendedoras,  todas son señoras que se unieron con el propósito de tener oportunidad de acceder a una oportunidad de crecimiento por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo donde todas ellas trabajan en forma muy conjunta. 
Una de las miembros es la señora Ramona, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, comenta que este negocio le está ayudando a darle a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Cuenta que la venta de prendas de segunda mano va en ascenso, pues es más económico para las personas y eso le ayuda a tener buenos clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con más prendas, ya que se viene el invierno y quiere poder darles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The “San Roque” committee is composed of ten very enterprising women.  They are all ladies that joined together with the purpose of having the opportunity to have access to a growth opportunity through teamwork.  The group is currently in its third cycle; all of them work very well together.

One of the members is Ramona who sells second-hand clothes.  She comments that this business has helped her give her family what they need day to day.  She comment that selling second-hand clothes is on the rise because it’s more economical for people and this helps her to have good customers.

She requests the loan to be able to stock up on more clothes because winter is approaching and she wants to be able to have more variety of clothes available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina Comité Kuña Guapa conformado por un total de 10 Mujeres, tanto las integrantes como sus familias realizan trabajos de agricultura, crías de animales, y otras tienen una pequeña despensa. Actualmente ya se encuentran en el tercer ciclo están trabajando bien, juntas logran los objetivos propuesto por el comité. 
La Sra. Iluminada es muy trabajadora como todas sus compañeras, ella cuando empezó con su comité tenía un pequeño copetín y hoy día su copetín es el más visitado en la zona, ya tiene una clientela formada, con la mayor generación de ingreso pudo construir para su baño moderno. 
Esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, como ser bebidas, golosinas, galletitas y demás, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Kuña Guapa” and it has ten female members.  The members and their families work in agriculture, raise livestock and some have small grocery stores.  They are currently already in their third cycle working well; together they are able to reach the goal set by the committee.

Iluminada is very hardworking just like her fellow members.  When she started in the committee she had a small snack shop and today it’s the most heavily patronized in the zone; she has a well established clientele.  With her increased income she was able to build a modern bathroom.

On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and others to be able to continue working and offering a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and others.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Kuña Pyapy Mbareté” Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación mediante la promoción hecha a una de las integrantes. El comité está integrado por 10 mujeres de la misma zona, quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar con entusiasmo para así salir adelante. 
Forma parte del grupo la señora Mariana, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo. Entre lo que prepara tenemos sándwiches, empanadas, croquetas, milanesas, y demás comidas. Nos comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que hace. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano para poder preparar las comidas que vende. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, mayonesa, pan, lechuga y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir preparando los alimentos que está vendiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Pyapy Mbareté” women’s committee started working with the Fundación thanks to promotional activities of one of its members.  The committee has ten female members from the same zone who are all friends and neighbors in that city.  They are very united, responsible and supportive of each other; they very much want to work with enthusiasm to get ahead this way.

Mariana is part of this group.  She sells all kinds of food. Among the things she prepares are sandwiches, turnovers, croquettes, breaded steaks and other dishes.  She comments that she has a good clientele who always buy the things she prepares.  She works every day from very early on to prepare the dishes she sells.

She’s asking for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, mayonnaise, bread, lettuce and other ingredients she will use to continue preparing food to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, mayonnaise, bread, lettuce and other ingredients.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them. Grace runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, eggs, sugar, soap, etc. 

Grace requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James has been running a spare parts shop for the past five years with great success. He is 52 years old and a married father with four school-going children. This marks James’ first business loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase more bicycle pedals, bicycle tires and motorcycle spare parts. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. He hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle pedals, bicycle tires and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Candelaria requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish making business. In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Virgen de Fátima”, está constituido  por  14  señoras muy activas y trabajadoras, que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder salir delante de esa forma darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus familias. El grupo está en el decimo tercer ciclo y desean seguir adelante en el programa. 
Luz es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de toda variedad de joyas. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Comenta que sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos y ella les trae a muy buen precio y calidad. 
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con más variedad de joyas, como ser anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos de joyas, ya que tiene también pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The committee called "Virgen de Fátima" is made up of 14 very active and hardworking women who always make the maximum effort to be able to get ahead. In this way they are able to give a better lifestyle to their families. The group is in its third loan cycle and they wish to continue going forward with the program.

Luz is part of this group. She works selling all varieties of jewelry. She is a very enterprising person with a desire to get ahead through her work. She says that her customers are always placing orders and she brings it to them for a very good price and quality. She is asking for a loan to be able to stock up on more varieties of jewelry such as rings, bracelets, chains and other types of jewelry, since she already has orders that she'd like to be able to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains, and other types of jewelry.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: This time, Imelda is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. This business was previously funded through KIVA and partner NWTF to continue and provide for Imelda and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Phoebe has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Phoebe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Phoebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, shampoo, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 34 and married with three children between 10 and seven years old. He has been farming actively for five successive years and currently engages the services of one farmhand on a permanent basis. His farm produces milk and maize, which are sold to the local market.

Robert has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the growth in farming income will help him to provide the basic needs for the family and improve his other businesses, especially the milling one, which he runs within the local market.

He laments of the challenge posed by both crop and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. Josefa has been in this business for 3 years.

Josefa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, shampoo, deodorant and other cosmetics to sell to her customers. 

In the future, Josefa would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, shampoo, deodorant and other cosmetics

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Riza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Riza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Riza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beverages, detergents, canned goods and snacks to sell

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is involved in fishing. She is 29 years old, married with 6 children with ages from 2 months to 12 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.

Nelsie has been fishing for 8 years. She works with her husband and sells his catch at the market. She earns about 8,500 PHP per month doing this fishing. Nelsie has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and floaters. Nelsie hopes to have a stable income that would enable her to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and floaters

loans.name: Ekamais

texts.en:
Ekamais is 38 years old, married to Selina and blessed with four children, ages 17, 15, 12 and 10 years respectively. Ekamais has a grocery stall where he sells fruits and vegetables. He started this business a year ago and earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. Profit made will aid him in repaying his loan and improve his living standard.

Ekamais' dream is to one day purchase a piece of land and build his own house, as well as to see his children get the best education. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 25 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Janice has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, eggs, canned goods, soap, etc.. 

In the future, Janice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years of age yet untiringly generates income for the family. She is a vinegar maker in the village. Her spouse helps her through delivering vinegar to the different stores.

Josephine would like to provide maintenance for their equipment so that it will remain fast and productive. For this reason, Josephine is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy ingredients for vinegar and bottles and to do maintenance to her equipment.

loans.use: to buy bottles and ingredients for vinegar and to do maintenance on her equipment

loans.name: Genely

texts.en:
Genely is 24 years old and has two children. Genely is married and one of her children is in school.

Genely is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Genely requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and piglets.

Genely has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Genely would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Precille

texts.en:
Precille works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Precille requested a 4,100 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Precille is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old, married to Jane and blessed with three children. He has a grocery stall where he sells fruits and vegetables and cereals. He started this business a year ago and earns a monthly income of 9,700 KES. 

Peter has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fruits, vegetables, beans and green grams for sale. Profit made will aid him in paying his rent. 

His dream is to one day purchase a piece of land and build his own house, as well as to see his children get the best education. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, beans and green grams

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 59 years old and widowed with 3 children. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store. Luz has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 27-year-old lady from Migori town and is married to Joseph. They have 2 kids.

Pauline operates a welding and fabrication workshop, a business she has been doing for the last 4 years. She makes a monthly income of 25,000 KES. She is taking her 5th loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy metals for welding work. Her profits will be used to educate her children.

Her dream is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy metals for welding work.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, age 52, lives at Caggay. She is patiently selling fruits and vegetables to the people at the village where they live. She has been doing it for four years in order to gain an income to meet her family's daily consumption. She has five children but lives separately from them. 

Now, Flordeliza is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a tray of eggs, bananas, cabbages and string beans to sell.

In the future, she hopes to grow her small business and earn enough income to save funds to use for unexpected expenses.

loans.use: to buy eggs, bananas, cabbages and string beans to sell

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en:
Welyneth is 25 years old and is married with a 3-year-old child. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Welyneth has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. She earns 2,800 PHP per month with this business. Welyneth has requested a loan to purchase pigs, feed and other materials. She hopes for her hog-raising business to grow in the future. She also hopes to be able to save for her child's future education.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and other materials

loans.name: Robert Jhun

texts.en:
Robert Jhun is 34 years old, married and has one child. The family lives simply at their small house at Bayo. To earn an income, Robert Jhun provides motorcycle transport service to the people in their village. He has been offering the service for almost 10 years now and gains PHP 300 daily. He needs a loan for motorcycle maintenance. He is asking for PHP 12,000 to buy crude oil and gasoline to use in the motorcycle.

In the future, Robert Jhun would like to further enhance his business and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and gasoline for maintaining his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del barrio San Isidro  surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2010. Actualmente se encuentran  en el 6º ciclo de programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Zunilda,  ella se dedica  a la venta de bebidas en general en forma muy exitosa en su barrio.  Comenta que los fines de semana es cuando tiene más ventas y le va muy bien en el negocio. 
Ella quiere poder tener bien surtido su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, con lo que podrá seguir teniendo bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
This group from the San Isidro neighborhood arose thanks to promotions done in the zone.  They’ve been working with the Fundación since 2010.  At present they are in their 6th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program.

One of the members of the group is Zunilda.  She sells beverages in general quite successfully in her neighborhood.  She comments that weekends is when she has the most sales and that she does very well in the business.

She wants to have the business well stocked which is why she’s asking for the loan to buy beverages to continue having the business well stocked.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lida Maria

texts.es:
Lida nació en Loja pero vive en Guayaquil. Es soltera, tiene  33 años. Tiene un hijo menor que asiste a la escuela pública. 
Termino sus estudios y se dedico a la costura. Actualmente su trabajo lo realiza en casa sola, empieza su trabajo en la mañana y descansa cuando termina su obra. En la actualidad el único problema que se le presenta son los ladrones ya que vive sola y es vulnerable a este tipo de delincuencia. Nos indica se responsable y lo demuestra en sus logros, este es el 3 préstamo y lo necesita para comprar telas, hilos.  Sus planes futuros es comprar maquinas y poner un atelier para brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Lidia was born in Loja but lives in Guayaquil.  She’s single and 33 years old.  She has a minor son who attends public school.  She finished her schooling and went into sewing.  She currently does her work at home alone and the only problem she faces are thieves since she lives alone and is vulnerable to this type of violence.  She indicates that she’s responsible and she proves it with her accomplishments.  This is her third loan and she needs it to buy fabric and thread.  Her future plan is to buy machines and set up a workshop to provide her son with a better future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, se dedica a la producción de leche y también  a las actividades agrícolas junto a toda su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar dos vacas  lecheras y de esta forma aumentar sus volúmenes de producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos, para la manutención de su familia ya que es la única fuente de trabajo con la que cuentan.
Javier, es casado y tiene tres hijos, viven en Achacachi en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier is a dairy farmer and also farms with his entire family.  He needs the loan to buy two dairy cows to increase the volume of milk produced and thus his income to support his family since this is the only source of income they have.  

Javier is married and has three children.  They live in Achacachi in the city of La Paz.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 37 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Gilda works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda runs a variety store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

Gilda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Gilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel works hard to support two children. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Liezel requested a PHP 4,100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Liezel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Yuldah

texts.en:
Yuldah is a mother of 10 children with the first seven already adults and the last three still juniors and still schooling. She has been active in farming for eight successive years and currently sells her produce of maize and vegetables to the local market to meet her family's basic needs.

Yuldah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She wants to venture into dairy farming in order to get milk to supplement her family meals as well as to generate income to ensure the education of her last-born children who still live with her.

She is keen on repaying the loan on time and reiterates Juhudi Kilimo loans have been of great help to many smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married with three children. Francisca is 47 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Francisca sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for additional capital.

Francisca has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Francisca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier de 51 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. María, ella es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos menores, que están estudiando. 
Don Javier se inicio hace mas de 25 años en el rubro de la electricidad, comenzó trabajando en una empresa privada, después de muchos años se independizo, realiza trabajos a domicilio como instalación y mantenimiento, instalaciones eléctricas domiciliarias, mantenimientos, etc. 
Solicita ayuda con un préstamo para compra de materias primas para realizar su trabajo como gas para aire, cables, conexiones, etc. A través de este crédito el va a poder seguir dando a su clientela servicio de buena calidad y a bajo costo para de esa forma mantener su clientela y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Javier, 51, is married to María who is a housewife.  They have two minor children attending school.  Over 25 years ago Javier started to work as an electrician first for a private firm and after many years independently.  He does in-home jobs like installations and maintenance, home electrical installations, service, etc.

He’s asking for help from a loan to buy raw materials to do his work like Freon gas, cables, connections, etc.  Through this loan he will be able to continue to give his customers good quality, low cost service to retain his customers and his income.

loans.use: to buy Freon gas, cables, connections, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,perfumes,cremas y esmaltes de uñas,la socia tambien vende carteras y zapatos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza,carteras y zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys continues devoting herself to her business of selling beauty products like lipstick, perfumes, creams, and nail polish.  She also sells wallets and shoes.  Her dream is to have a place where she would be able to sell beauty products, wallets, and shoes.

She is requesting the loan to buy creams, perfumes, and lipsticks.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Jhon Richard

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de peluches,pero tambien ahora esta vendiendo joyas como collares,aretes y pulseras,el socio vende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el local de venta de peluches.La socia solicita el credito para comprar peluches y tambien comprar aretes,collares y pulseras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: He continues selling stuffed toys but he’s also now selling jewelry like necklaces, earrings and bracelets.  He sells from 7am until 7pm and through this business is able to support his children.  His dream is to expand and improve his stuffed toys sales place.   He needs the loan to buy stuffed toys and also to buy earrings, necklaces and bracelets.  He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys, earrings, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and has three children. She lives in Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Each month Victoria earns 4,200 PHP. She joined GDMPC in 2011. 

Victoria is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase new items of clothing to expand her product offering. In the future, she hopes positively for her business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Estrellita has a vulcanizing shop that repairs flat wheels and tires and her husband is the operator. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools like T-wrenches and an air compressor & to pay for the electricity for the services.

Estrellita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Estrellita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools like screw drivers, an air compressor and T-wrenches

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph (pictured here with two dairy goats) is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He produces maize, beans, poultry products and goat milk for the local market. He has been in farming for four years. He is aged 32 and married with one child age 4.

Joseph has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and boost his farming business. He hopes to improve his flock of dairy goats as well and make life better for the family, specifically with the provision of better health care and education in the future.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia vende maiz y cereales,la socia vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de maiz y cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz y cereales.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Madai continues to devote herself to the business of selling grains.  She sells corn and grains from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to expand her business of selling corn and grains.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn and grains.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and grains.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel has been operating a restaurant in Nyahururu town for the last five years. He is 66 years of age, married to Esther and has two children. This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of baking flour, rice and cooking oil for use in his restaurant business. In the future, Samuel hopes to expand his business and serve more customers, hence making more income.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: For her sixth loan cycle, Gina is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan to buy piglets and fodder. Her general store, which she previously funded through Kiva and NWTF, continues to provide Gina and her family with an increasing income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fodder

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 56 years old and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a widow.  For the past 13 years, Clara has been raising cows in the Philippines and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Clara is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed for her cows. In the future, she would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cow feed

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 26 years old and married with three children.

Christina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Christina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from e-loading (for phones) and videoke (video karaoke) rentals.

Christina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy sugar, confectioneries and basic household necessities for resale. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, confectioneries and basic household necessities for resale.

loans.name: Tututepec Los Almendros Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tututepec los almendros  esta conformado por nueve personas trabajadoras, humildes orgullosas de ser parte de fundacion y de su localidad.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de  la localidad de Tututepec la localidad  cuenta con un museo  cual  se llama Yuku Saa que en idioma mixteco se significa  cerro del pájaro,  esta localidad  es mejor conocida como tutu  la localidad  esta en un cerro alto donde al llegar a la comunidad te encuentras un letrero hermoso blanco en la punta del cerro que dice viva cristo rey , ese letrero lo hicieron la gente de la comunidad , dándole gracias a dios por su localidad y familias.
En la localidad hay muchos sembradíos de limón, papaya y chile hay una presa llamada presa de rió verde  y sistema de riego.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Catalina de  veinte nueve años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora alegre y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de tortillas echas a mano desde hace  cinco años.
Doña Cata  como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  tiene  dos hijos a quien quiere mucho  sus hijos se llaman Emmanuel de  nueve años de edad, Josué de cinco años de edad , se siente muy contenta por todo el apoyo de  fundacion  para que pueda seguir con su negocio  ya que es madre soltera y tiene que trabajar el  doble para darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos.
Doña Cata nos cuenta que  anteriormente  trabajaba en casa  cocinando, lavando pero gracias al apoyo de fundacion ya tiene su pequeño negocio y puede ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus hijos  y estar más tiempo con ellos.
Doña Cata pidió el préstamo para la compra de más maíz, cal, leños y cal para la elaboración para la elaboración de  tortillas.
Doña Cata nos cuenta que se levanta desde las tres de la mañana  a lavar su nixtamal y  se va a l molino regresa del molino prende su comal y le hace de almorzar a sus hijos los lleva  la escuela de regreso se dedica hacer sus tortillas y a venderlas.
Doña Cata esta agradecida con fundacion por ayudar a  las madres solteras con deseos de superarse y mejorar  la vida  de sus hijos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Eustiquia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Aide-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Floriberta-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Sandra-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Everardo-quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Lucia-quien se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Irene-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por su apoyo.
texts.en:
This group is called Tututepec Los Almendros and it’s composed of nine hardworking, humble people who are proud to be part of the Fundación and of their location.  The members of this group are from the location of Tututepec which has a museum called Yuku Saa which in the Mixteco language means “hill of the bird.” The town is better known as Tutu.  It’s on a high hill and when you arrive at the community you come upon a beautiful white sigh on the top of the hill that says “Viva Cristo Rey.”   The sign was made by the people in the community thanking God for their location and their families.  There are many lemon, papaya and chili fields and there’s a dam called “Presa de Río Verde” and an irrigation system.

One of the members of this group is Catalina, 29.  She’s noted for being a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She has been selling hand-made tortillas for five years.  

Doña Cata, as she’s better known by her fellow group members, has two children she loves very much.  Her children are called Emmanuel who is nine and Josué who is five years old.  She feels very happy for all the support from the Fundación so that she can continue in business since she’s a single mother and has to work twice as hard to give her children a better life.

Doña Cata tells us that she used to work in a home cooking and doing laundry but thanks to support from the Fundación she now has her small business and is able to offer her children a better life and spend more time with them.

Doña Cata asked for the loan to buy more corn, logs and lime powder to make tortillas.

Doña Cata tells us that she rises at three in the morning to wash her corn and go to the mill.  She returns from the mill, lights her griddle and makes breakfast for her children.  She takes them to school and when she returns starts making tortillas to sell.

Doña Cata is grateful to the Fundación for helping single mothers who want to improve themselves and the lives of their children.

The other group members are:

Eustiquia-who sells Mexican fast-food snacks
Elizabeth- who sells Mexican fast-food snacks
Aidé-who sells groceries
Floriberta- who sells Mexican fast-food snacks
Sandra-who sells clothes
Everardo-who sells fruit and vegetables
Lucía-who sells candy
Irene-who sells chicken

They all thank the Fundación for its support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortillas.

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack is a resident of Nkubu area in Central Kenya and has 15 years in farming. He also operates a food restaurant in the local market. He says farming and food businesses are his only sources of income. He is 39 and married with four children who are 17, 13, 8 and 3 years old.

Isack has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets for a new venture into pig farming. He plans to own at least 60 pigs and says he will use the income mainly to educate his children.

He mentions the high cost of feed and limited rain as the major challenges in farming but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's support for farmers’ growth.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Marlina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Marlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Randolf

texts.en:
Randolf is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishnet and other materials for his fishing business.

Randolf has been in this business for 17 years. Randolf earns more income from raising pigs.

Randolf has been sustaining his business activities through he own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams of saving money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishnet and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum is 30 years old, single and blessed with three children who are 12, 8 ande 5 years old. She operates a cafeteria business, which she started six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bags of rice, beans and sugar for her cafeteria business. The profit she earns from it will be ploughed back into her business. 

Her dream is to one day buy dairy cows that will supply her with milk. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, beans and sugar for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. For the past two years, she has operated a hog-fattening business. Edna earns 2,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

Edna is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase sacks of feed and piglets. In the future, she hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is the father of a two-year-old child. For the past 15 years, he has been a farmer and he also operates a retail shop to supplement his farming income. Wilson's farm produces milk which he supplies to the local market. He laments the shortage of animal feed which results in high costs.

Wilson is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter. Acquiring these two assets will improve his ability to feed his dairy cows and enable him improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as sugars, confectioneries and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as sugars, confectionery and beverages

loans.name: San Jose Las Parotas Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama San José las Parotas  esta conformado por  ocho personas trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de triunfar y cumplir sus sueños.
Las integrantes  de este grupo son originarios de  un pequeño pueblo llamado San José un lugar donde hay muchos árboles verdes, hay arbole de mango, tamarindo y mangos.
En la comunidad de San José vez a los niños jugando en las calles y a las mujeres trabajando vendiendo comida o tamales en las calles.
San José es un pueblo pequeño con mucha  flora y también muchos pequeños negocios  y gente con deseos de superación.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Rosario una señora que se caracteriza por ser alegre y amable.
Doña Chayo   como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo tiene  treinta y tres años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de  calzado de diferentes marcas, colchas por catalogo desde  cinco años.
Doña Chayo nos cuenta  que tiene  tres hijos: Ricardo de nueve años de edad, Brayam de once años de edad  y Jonatan de nueve años de edad.
Doña Chayo esta felizmente casada con el señor  Isidro de  cuarenta y dos años de edad don Isidro poscuenta que esta muy orgullosa de su esposa por querer superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida ya que los dos trabajan para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Doña  Chayo nos cuenta que anteriormente  desde hace ocho años atrás tenia un local con manualidades  pero no le dada buenas ganancias a si que decidió vender colchas ya que  ese negocio si le deja buenas ganancias.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más catálogos  confort y colchas para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes  del grupo  son:

Romualda- se dedica a  la venta de pescado.
Francisco- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Belén- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Epigmenia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Patricia- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Minerva- se dedica a la venta de de catálogos de calzado.
Victoria- se dedica a la venta de bisutería.


Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente humilde para que puedan engrandecer su negocio.
texts.en:
This group is called San José las Parotas and it’s composed of 8 hardworking, humble people who want to succeed and make their dreams a reality.  The members of this group are from a small town called San José, a place with many green trees; there are mango and tamarind trees.  In the community of San José you see children playing in the streets and the women selling food or tamales in the streets.  San José is a small town with abundant flora and also many small businesses and people who want to get ahead.

One of the members of the group is Rosario, a woman who is noted for being cheerful and kind.  Doña Chayo as she’s better known by her fellow group members is 33 years old and has been selling various brands of shoes and bedspreads via catalogue for the last five years.

Doña Chayo tells us that she has three children:  Ricardo, 9, Brayam, 11 and Jonatan, 9.  Doña Chayo is happily married to Isidro, 42.  Isidro tells us that he’s very proud of his wife for wanting to improve herself and her quality of life since both of them work to provide a better life for their family.

Doña Chayo tells us that she used to work 8 years ago in a crafts shop she had but it didn’t produce good profits so she decided to sell bedspreads and this business does produce good profits.  

She asked for the loan to buy more Confort catalogues and bedspreads to sell at retail and wholesale.

The other group members are:    


Romualda- sells fish
Francisco- sells fruit and vegetables
Belén- sells perfume
Epigmenia- sells Mexican fast-food snacks
Patricia- sells fruit and vegetables
Minerva- sells shoes via catalogue
Victoria- sells costume jewelry

They thank the Fundación for helping humble people so that they can enlarge their businesses.

loans.use: to buy catalogues and bedspreads to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: This time, for her sixth loan cycle, Angie is applying for a loan of PHP 19,000 to fund her general store business. This business was previously funded through NWTF, a KIVA partner, to continue to provide for Angie and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi works hard to support her family. She is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Naomi requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in their community.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Naomi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in their community.

loans.name: Las Palmyx Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  se llama Las  Palmyx esta conformado por  trece mujeres trabajadoras  y humildes que se dedican a diversas actividades económicas.
Las integrantes de este grupo  son originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Mancuernas  un  pueblo bonito con árboles verdes y gente trabajadora.
Una  de las tradiciones de mancuernas es  que celebra  la fiesta del pueblo  cada quince de mayo, vienen los juegos y hay mucha diversión para los niños.
Doña Maribel Elvia  se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa ella va a comparar su mercancía a la ciudad de Acapulco  cada mes.
Doña Mari como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de  grupo nos dice que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias.
Doña Maribel Elvia  tiene  treinta y siete años de edad, esta felizmente casada con el señor  Alfonso de  treinta y ocho años de edad, tienen   dos  hijos Jennifer Maribel de quince años de edad y Juan Luís de doce  años de edad.
Doña Mari pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ropa y calzado para la venta ya que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y así puede darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Rosalba- se dedica a servicio  de peluquería.
Eva- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Zaida-se dedica a la venta de carnicería.
Gloria- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Caritita Amilana- se dedica a la  venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de carne.
Maria Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Elvira- se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Irenea- se dedica a la comercialización de ganado.
Tomasa- se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes.
Julia- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Maria de los Ángeles- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Palmyx and it’s composed of 13 hardworking, humble women who carry out a variety of economic activities.  The members of this group are from a small town called Mancuernas, a pretty town with green trees and hardworking people.  One of the traditions in Mancuernas is celebrating the town’s feast day on May 15th.  Carnival rides come and there is much fun for the children.

Maribel Elvia sells shoes and clothes; she goes to Acapulco every month to buy her merchandise.  Doña Mari as she’s better known by her fellow group members tells us that she likes her business very much because it produces good profits.  Maribel Elvia is 37 years old, happily married to Alfonso, 38, and they have two children: Jennifer Maribel, 15 and Juan Luís, 12.

Mari asked for the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell since her business makes good profits so she can give her children a better life.

The other group members are:

Rosalba- barber
Eva- sells bread
Zaida-sells meat
Gloria- sells shoes
Caritita Amilana- sells groceries
Guadalupe- sells meat
Maria Guadalupe- sells food
Elvira- sells fish
Irenea- sells cattle
Tomasa- sells groceries
Julia- sells chickens
Maria de los Ángeles- sells shoes

They thank the Fundación for helping hardworking women.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: La Bugambilia Group

texts.es:
Justina cuenta 55 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijas: Soemi tiene 17 años y esta estudiando en un conalep, Iris Meli  esta en 3° de secundaria y por último Silvia que tiene de 4 años, ella se dedica al comercio vende quesos y tupperware  ya tiene 15 años con la venta de quesos ella sale a vender a las casas de sus vecinas en su pueblo ella compra y revende el queso. Justina invertirá el préstamo en la compra de quesos y trastes de plástico por catalogo ella dice que le va bien con su venta de quesos y espera que le vaya mejor le gustaría que su negocio creciera mas con la venta de los tupper.

Justina pertenece al grupo la bugambilia cuyo nombre le pusieron porque en la casa donde se reúnen esta una planta de flores bugambilia el grupo esta integrado por 16 mujeres comprometidas con el trabajo y a salir adelante cada día con sus negocios, a continuación serán mencionadas Regina, Evangelista, Anita, Eyely, Guillermina, Eymar, María, Felipa, Victoria, Felicitas, Maria, Paula, Justina, Roció, Evancia, Viridiana, todas tienen actividades comercial como son: productos de abarrotes, helados, venta de pollos, pescados, venta de quesos, pan, empanadas, bolillos, frutas, y verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Justina, 55, is a widow and has three daughters: Soemi, 17 and attending school at Conalep, Iris Meli, in 9th grade and lastly, Silvia who is 4 years old.  She is a merchant; she sells cheese and Tupperware.  She’s been selling cheese for 15 years already.  She buys the cheese and then goes out to her neighbors’ houses in the town to resell it.  Justina will use the loan to buy cheese and plastic dinnerware via catalogue.  She says that she does well with her cheese sales and hopes she will do better.  She’d like it  if her business grew more with the Tupperware sales.

Justina belongs to the “La Bugambilia” group.  They named their group thus because there is a bougainvillea flower plant in the house they meet in.  The group has 16 members who are women committed to work and get ahead every day with their businesses.   Following we mention: Regina, Evangelista, Anita, Eyely, Guillermina, Eymar, María, Felipa, Victoria, Felicitas, Maria, Paula, Justina, Roció, Evancia and Viridiana.  They all have their own commercial activities like groceries, ice-cream, chickens, fish, cheese, bread, turnovers, bread rolls, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy cheese and fish.

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FENIX” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido a groche de enaguas, tejido de chambras, venta de salteñas, costura de chamarras, venta de detergente, venta de queso, venta de ropa, venta de salchipapa, venta de celulares.

La señora Mónica, indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de salteñas y tucumanas que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de harina, materia prima con la que elabora los alimentos; posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FENIX” started its first cycle in Pro Mujer in the Juan Pablo neighborhood center.  It has nine members and is run by a board led by Monica.  
The members have various types of businesses such  as:crocheting lingerie, knitting jackets, knitting sweaters, selling salteñas (meat filled pastries), making sweaters, selling detergents, cheese, clothing, salchipapa (fried meat and potatoes), and mobile phones.

Monica says she started the communal association in Pro Mujer a year ago by inviting her friends. She now has a business making and selling  salteñas and tucumanas (meat filled pastries) that her parents taught her and she has done for years.

She will use the loan to buy flour, and basic ingredients to make the food: after she prepares it, she will market it where she sells.  The business will help her support her family since she lives with her partner and they have a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and finances.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 43 years old, married, and raising four children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the town of Cabrayil.  Nusrat has been involved in animal husbandry since 2004 to provide a source of income for his family. Animal husbandry is the family business: Nusrat's father and brother are also actively involved in breeding livestock. 

Nusrat is requesting an 800 AZN loan from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy a cow with a calf. He hopes to further develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase cow with a calf

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past five years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines.

Delia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Indelicia

texts.en:
Indelicia is 34 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 12 years, Indelicia has run a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Indelicia is requesting a 13,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and equipment

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a farmer in Kitale area who is married with eight adult children. For the past 10 years, she has run a farm and has employed one farmhand. She currently produces milk, maize, beans and eggs for the local market.

Ruth is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry and boost her poultry farm and the butcher shop she owns in the local market. She believes that poultry disease remains a threat to her business. Ruth is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em is requesting a new loan to buy a wide variety of basic goods to restock her general store. Her loan will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Em's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and improve sales which will help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic goods to sell

loans.name: Vania

texts.es:
La socia Vania alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías como muñecas, mantas, ceramicas entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, a la vez la socia quiere empesar un nuevo negocio con su hermano el cual consiste en realizar una cancha sintetica ,aun la socia esta aumentado poco a poco su capital para empesar a construir su nuevo negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el prestamo para aumentar su capital para empesar su nuevo negocio.
 

La socia Vania se compromete a cancelar todas sus cuotas en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Vania sells handicrafts such as dolls, blankets and ceramics among other items. She is responsible and hardworking person.  At the same time she would like to start a new business with her brother which consist of building and renting out a synthetic playing field. She is still slowly saving up the capital to begin constructing the new field. In this way she will be able to move her family forward.

She is applying for a loan to expand her capital so she can start her new business.

Vania promises to make all her payments within the time stipulated.

loans.use: to expand her capital to start her new business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice, a 29-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has been a farmer growing coco and grapes for native wine for the past four years. A member of PMPC for two years, she is requesting a loan to purchase house renovation materials such as wood, nails, and galvanized steel and to pay for labor. Janice hopes to be able to save money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase house renovation materials such as wood, nails, and galvanized steel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ma. Azucena

texts.en: Ma.Azucena, a 56-year-old married mother of five, has run  a general store in the Philippines for the past two years, selling a variety of items such as shampoo, soft-drinks and other groceries.  Now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store, she wants to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Wangninan Group
