texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINAN est composé de vingt quatre personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine et habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Agnès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Siméon. Agnès est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés, mais trois sont à sa charge. Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Agnès mène comme activité, la vente de poissons frais et des friperies de façon secondaire dans un marché du Bénin. Agnès exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d’année et s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WANGNINAN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAN group is made up of twenty-four people who belong to the same savings group and live in the same neighborhood.  It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise their level of activity.

Agnès, raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative.  She is 31 years old and married to a fisherman named Siméon.  Agnès is the mother of four children, all in school, but three being her dependents.  Agnès lives with her husband and takes care of the various household expenses together with her husband.  In order to provide for the family, and for the past fifteen years or so, Agnès has been selling fresh fish and, additionally, second-hand clothes at a market in Benin.  She buys her supplies in Benin.

Eager to meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Agnès is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANGNINAN group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is hardworking mother of three children. She is happilyy married to a farmer. Cresencia is 52 years old and manages a sari-sari (variety) store business. Cresencia approximately earns an income of 6,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly from her sari-sari store by selling biscuits, candies, soft drinks and some goods that are consumed daily.
 
Cresencia dreams to gain a higher income from the business. Her income is a big help for the family's daily needs and consumption in their house. Cresencia wishes for a loan of P25,000 to buy additional grocery items to put in her store and sell in their village. She hopes that she increases the number of customers who buy in her store and increases her profit as well.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 55-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Vicenta is also a farmer. She plants rice crops on their land. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm. Vicenta, on the other hand, runs a small sari-sari (variety) store to help with their daily needs.

Vicenta has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. Vicenta hopes for their businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Asger

texts.en: Asgar is 43 years old, married and has three children. He is an IDP person coming originally from the city of Cabrayil. Asgar has 12 years of experience in animal breeding and he is engaged in buying and selling dairy cows. Also he raises and fattens 2 heads of cattle with calves. Seeking to expand his business even further, Asgar approached AqroInvest with a request for a loan of 1000 AZN in order to purchase cattle feed aimed at fattening and reselling the livestock. Thanks to his hard work and persistence, today Asgar's business contains 4 dairy cows and 2 calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: El Capulin (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama el capulín y se integra de tres señoras quienes cada una se dedica a su actividad y vive en una  localidad llamada miguel hidalgo.

    Quien se le tomo la entres vista se llama Elísea  ella  vive en unión libre con el señor  Claudio con quien procreo siete hijos quienes  aun  esta  a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollos de  rancho para luego venderlo destazado en donde lleva trabajando quince años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado obteniendo ingresos en su hogar.

     Con esta actividad inicio ya  que también quiere aportar con  los ingresos de la casa para que su  familia  no le haga  falta lo más necesario.

     Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad siga adelante hasta apoyar a sus hijos con su educación y también ellos sigan a delante.

     Las personas quienes integran en el grupo son:

   Flavia  quien  invertirá el préstamo  en la compra y venta de  marranos para venderlo por kilo y la señora Zoraida invertirá en la compra  y venta de joyas.
texts.en:
The group is called El Capulín and is made up of three women. They each make a living performing their economic activity and live in a locality called Miguel Hidalgo.

Elísea was interviewed. She lives in a common law marriage with Claudio with whom she has seven children who still in her care.

She requested the loan to invest in the purchase and sale of ranch chicken which she later sells butchered where she has been working for fifteen years. She says that things are going well for her since she has been able to obtain income for her household with the loan.

She began this economic activity since she also wants to contribute to the household earnings so that her family isn't lacking anything that's most necessary.

What she would like is for this small economic activity to continue moving forward until it can support her children's' education so that they can also get ahead.

The members of the group are:

Flavia, who will invest the loan in the purchase and sale of pigs to sell by the kilo; and Soraida, who will invest it in the purchase and sale of jewelry.

loans.use: to buy ranch chickens.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in attracting more customers and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a married woman with 5 children.  One is enrolled in school. She buys and sells goats and cows at the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Her customers are the local residents. With the Ksh. 40,000, she intends to buy more goats and cows to expand her business. She describes her major challenge to be transportation, and aspires to open a shop in future. She joined Yehu so as to get some loans. Umazi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows to expand her business.

loans.name: Camal

texts.en:
Camal is a 31 year-old man who lives with his family in Bilasuvar. He is an IDP person coming originally from the city of Cabrayil.  Thanks to his hardwork, he was able to expand his business to a monthly income of 300 AZN from milk and meat product sales. Additionally, Camal raises cows. 

This is his first credit in the amount of 1000 AZN. Camal requested this loan to purchase three dairy cows. He hopes that this loan will help to improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase three dairy cows

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a widowed woman with 6 children.  One is enrolled in school. She operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business in her rural area. She has been in the business for 2 years. Mejumaa intends to use the loan of Ksh.50,000 to pay school fees. She joined Yehu to secure loans for her business. She aspires to buy another motorcycle in the future. Mejumaa owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old. He is married to Alice and they have one child. He operates a barber shop and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET,  LTD. by a client.  He will use the loan to buy a modern shaving machine.  He hopes to expand his business by starting up a beauty salon.

He hopes to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a modern shaving machine

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 5 children.  Lilia has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Lilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, breads, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy has been in farming for six years, producing milk, maize and poultry products for the local market. She is married and has four children between sixteen and four years. She runs a milk retail business in the local market, with milk being sourced from her farm as well as from the local farmers who sell at the farm gate.

Emmy has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes this will provide adequate milk for family consumption and boost her dairy business too. She aspires to expand her business and givea  better education to her children.

She remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo  for their support of small hold farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is a married man with 4 children, three of whom are enrolled in school. He operates a bodaboda (motor bike) in his rural area. He has been doing so for the last 2 years. Part of his loan of Ksh. 25,000 will be used to pay school fees and the remaining amount to service his motorcycle. He describes his major challenge to be seasonality, especially during rainy season. Luka’s main goal is to buy another motorcycle in the future. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees and the remaining amount to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a 39 year-old mechanic who owns a spare parts shop in Mariakani. He is a married father of four school-aged children. He has been running this business for the past seven years with great success.

This marks Luke’s fourth business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more bicycle pedals, bicycle tires and motorcycle spare parts for sale. 


He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. He hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle pedals, bicycle tires and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Localidad El Carrizo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Localidad el  Carrizo  esta integrado por seis personas trabajadoras e humildes con deseos de cambiar  su vida  y la de su familia.
Los integrantes de este  grupo son originarios de la localidad del carrizo  un pueblo pequeño donde hay muchos árboles de ciruela, mango y almendras.
 La localidad  se puede admirar  como los niños corren en las calles, juega fútbol, andan en bicicleta y salen en las tardes a volar su papalote todos muy contentos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora Olivia Micaela  de treinta y dos años de edad, doña Olivia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace doce años.
Doña Olivia como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  nos comenta  que  lo que más le gusta de su negocio  es salir a vender en las calles  de su comunidad y comunidades vecinas.
Doña Olivia se caracteriza por ser una señora alegre y  humilde con deseos de mejorar su negocio y así  obtener una   mejor calidad de vida.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Alfonso de  treinta y siete años de edad  con quien tiene  tres hijos Deisi de trece años de edad,Melissa de catorce años de edad , Alfonso de siete años de edad.
Nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender bien a sus clientes y tener sus pedidos a tiempo para que se sientan contentos y otra vez le vuelvan a comprar.
Uno de las cosas por cual doña Olivia decidió iniciar su propio negocio es para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y así poder ayudarles para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
Doña Olivia pidió su préstamo para la compra de  más cosméticos para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Esta muy agradecida con   fundacion por ayudar a todas las personas  para que su vida mejore y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y ser independientes.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Maria Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Isaías Adolfo - se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Jerónimo Francisco- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Patricia Juana - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Feliciana- se dedica a la venta de  comida.

El grupo Localidad del Carrizo le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las personas de los pueblos y darles una esperanza de vida y un sueño para sus niños.
texts.en:
This group is called Localidad El Carrizo and is made up of six hardworking, humble people who have a desire to change their and their families' lives.

The members of this group come from the locality of Carrizo, a small town where there are many plum, mango, and almond trees.

The locality can be admired as kids happily run through the streets, play soccer, bike ride, and go out in the afternoons to fly their kites.

One of the members of this group is Olivia Micaela who's thirty-two years old. Mrs. Olivia has made a living selling cosmetics for twelve years.

Mrs. Olivia, as her group members know her, tells us that what she likes most about her business is going out to sell cosmetics in her community's streets and those of neighboring communities.

She is characterized as being a happy and humble woman with a desire to improve her business and thus obtain a better quality of life.

She is happily married to Alfonso who's thirty-seven years old and with whom she has three children: Deisi who's thirteen years old, Melissa who's fourteen years old, and Alfonso who's seven years old.

She tells us that what she likes most about her job is tending to her customers and having their orders on time so that they feel happy and buy from her again.

One of the reasons for which Mrs. Olivia decided to begin her own business was to give a better life to her children and thus be able to help them so that they can have a better future.

Mrs. Olivia requested the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell wholesale and retail.

She is very thankful for the foundation for helping everyone so that their lives improve and they can have a better quality of life and be independent.

The other members of the group are:

Maria Guadalupe, who makes a living selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes.
Isaías Adolfo, who makes a living selling fruit and vegetables.
Jerónimo Francisco, who makes a living selling perfume.
Patricia Juana, who makes a living selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes.
Feliciana, who makes a living selling food.

The group Localidad El Carrizo thanks the foundation for helping people from small towns and giving them hope for a better life and a dream for their children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Norma Etanislada

texts.es:
Doña Norma Etanislada es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido por muchos años, su negocio consiste en la venta de medicina natural la cual la tiene desde hace 14 años la que le ha permitido generar sus propios ingresos para el pan de cada día en su hogar donde habita solo con su esposo.
Es una señora de buenas costumbres que educó a sus hijos de igual manera los que ahora son personas independientes que le ayudan a su mamá en lo que pueden.
Tiene seis años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado siete créditos todos para surtir el inventario de productos que vende con lo que atrae a sus clientes por la variedad de los mismos.
Hoy en la actualidad necesita un crédito para la compra de champú, cremas, ungüentos, adelgazantes y jarabes ya que son los productos que más se mueven en su negocio y los de mayor demanda por lo que necesita invertir más en estos.
texts.en:
Norma Etanislada is from the town of El Sauce, where she has lived for many years. Her business is selling natural medicines, and she has been doing  this for 14 years. It has allowed her to generate her own income for her needs, in the home where she and her husband live.

She is a decent woman, who has raised her children to be the same. They are now independent people who help their mother whatever way they can.

She has been working with Ceprodel for six years. She has been granted seven loans, all to supply the inventory of products she sells, and with which she attracts her customers because of her varied selection.

Now she needs a loan to buy shampoo, creams, ointments, weight-reducers and cough syrups, as these are the products that sell the best in her business and are in greatest demand, so she needs to invest more in them.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, creams, ointments, weight-reducers, and cough syrups.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married man with 8 children, all enrolled in school. He is a farmer who operates his business at home, selling his farm produce to his neighbors. Ali has been farming for the past 3 years and describes his challenge as being the poor transport network. Ali intends to use his loan of KES 20,000 to invest in his farming business by purchasing seedlings and fertilizers. He hopes to buy powerful equipment to expand his business. Ali joined Yehu to access loans. Ali owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a married man with 5 children, three enrolled in school. For the past year, he has operated a kiosk where he sells his goods, mostly to his neighbors. Ali describes his challenge as being a poor market for his goods. He intends to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil. Ali joined Yehu to access loans, and hopes to open a whole shop. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ali's greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en: Buenaventurada, 57 years old, is a married woman with 7 children. She has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years. Her husband is also a farmer. Buenaventurada does her best to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es:
Mario es originario de Estelí, de 53 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos de los cuales solo 1 esta  a su cargo ya que los otros son mayores de edad viven independiente, el es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y es dueño de unos molinos. Inicio su actividad con dinero propio comprando dos molinos a la edad  de 42 años siendo este su primer negocio donde es apoyado por su compañera de vida la cual le ayuda en el trabajo del molino antes el se dedicaba a la actividad pecuaria, no cuentan con otros ingresos pero dice que el negocio es muy bueno ya que le ha generado buenas ganancias.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, el cual lo ayudara ya que podrá invertir mas en su  negocio con el objetivo de  salir adelante con su familia, como planes futuro espera llegar a comprar el lugar donde tiene el negocio ya que le disminuirían sus gastos pues dejaría de pagar alquiler, sus metas próximas es seguir trabajando para hacer que su negocio crezca y seguir preparando a sus hijos para que tengan estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Mario is 53 years old. He is from Estelí, and the father of three children, only one of whom is in his care, as the others are adults and live independently. He is a merchant by trade and sells basic staples. He also owns some mills. 

He started his business with his own money, buying two mills at the age of 42. This was his first business, and he is supported by his life companion who helps him with the milling work. He used to raise livestock. He doesn't have other income, but says that the business is very good, as it has generated good earnings for him.

He is applying for the loan to buy staples such as corn, beans, rice and sugar. This will help him because he will be able to invest more in his business, with the objective of moving forward together with his family. 

In the future he hopes to manage to buy a place where he can have his business, as this would reduce his expenses since he would stop paying rent. His near-term goal is to continue working in order to see his business grow, and also to keep educating his children so that they can study to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Lowotha

texts.en:
Lowotha, 25 years old, is married to Mary and they are blessed with two children. For the past 3 years, Lowotha has operated a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business, earning a monthly income of KES 8,600. 

Lowotha has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to service his motorbike. His profit will help him improve his living standards. Lowotha's dream is to purchase a piece of land, build a house and educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with no children. He has been doing commercial farming for the last 6 years, and also operates a shop as his side job. Juma describes his major challenge to be seasonality, especially during the dry season. 

Juma intends to use this KES 40,000 loan to buy two ox and a plough. He hopes to buy a water pump in the future. Juma joined Yehu due to their fair services. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to buy two ox and a plough

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 62 years old and is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. Claudia engaged in farming 13 years ago. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

Claudia also sells banana cue (a popular snack) to her neighborhood. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil and bananas. Claudia hopes for their farm and her food-vending business to grow. She also hopes for her family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil and bananas.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sol esta integrado por  diez personas trabajadoras humildes con deseos de  mejorar su calidad de vida, los integrantes de este grupo son  originarios de un pequeño pueblo llamado Tetepelcingo  donde  hay muchas matas de plátano y árboles verdes.
Al llegar a la comunidad  hay un rió que se llama rió grande  donde  se van a vallar y a lavar su ropa el rió tiene muy poco agua.
En la localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de servilletas ya que  es una de las cosas que  mas le gustan y qué sus antepasados le enseñaron.
En la localidad de Tetepelcingo  hacen fiestas los días  6,7 de mayo celebran la fiesta del pueblo viene  juegos, toritos y castillos  todos los ciudadanos van al parque a divertirse y los niños  se divierten subiéndose a los juegos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Teresa de treinta y cuatro años de edad doña teresa se dedican a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles desde hace  diez años.
Nos dice  que lo mas le gusta de su negocio es darles una buena atención a sus clientes ya que la piden las servilletas para bautizos y  quince años.
Doña Tere como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo nos dice que su mama  fue quien le enseño a elaborar las servilletas y combinar los colores para que se vean bonitas.
Doña Tere esta felizmente casada con el señor Elpidio de treinta y seis años de edad con quien tiene  cuatro hijos Julio David de dieciséis años de edad,Litzi de once años de edad, Cristian de ocho años de edad y Enrique de seis años de edad.
Doña Tere nos cuenta que en ocasiones no tiene hilos para trabajar y eso la pone muy triste ya que disfruta mucho su trabajo y se siente mal cuando no tiene los recursos  para hacer lo que mas le gusta que es elaborar  sus servilletas y manteles.
Doña Tere nos dice que esta muy contenta con su negocio le deja buenas  ganancias  y así puede darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Doña Tere pidió el préstamo para la copra  de más material para la elaboración de  servilletas como son: Hilo blanco, hilo de seda e Hilo de estambre.
Doña Tere nos dice que esta muy contenta con fundacion por apoyarla para que su negocio crezca y así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:


Inés- se dedica a la venta de  bordados.
Artemio- se dedica a la venta de chiles y semillas.
Maricela - se dedica a la venta de bordado.
Aída- se dedica a la venta de bordado.
Reina- se dedica a la venta de bordado.
Maria Susana- se dedica a la venta de bordado.
Rufina- se dedica a la venta de bordado-
Demetria- se dedica a la venta de bordado.
Petrona- se dedica a la venta de bordado.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente de pueblo maquinados con deseos de superarse ya que su pueblo es muy chico y pobre pero en tetepelcingo hay gente trabajadora  y muchos niños que necesitan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called Sol and is made up of ten hardworking, humble people with a desire to improve their quality of life. The members of this group are from a small town called Tetepelcingo where there are many banana plants and green trees.

Upon arriving to the community there is a river called Río Grande where they go to bathe and wash their clothing. The river has very little water.

In the locality the majority of the people make a living making tapestries as it's one of the things they like the most and that their ancestors taught them.

In the locality of Tetepelcingo they have a celebration. On the 6th and 7th of May they celebrate the town's holiday. There are rides, little bulls, and castles. All the residents go out to the park to have fun and the kids have fun going on the rides.

One of the members of this group is Teresa who's thirty-four years old. Mrs. Teresa has made a living making tapestries and tablecloths for ten years.

She tells us that what she likes most about her business is giving her customers good service since they ask for tapestries for baptisms and girls' fifteenth birthdays.

Mrs. Tere, as the members of her group know her, tells us that it was her mom who taught her how to make tapestries and combine colors to look beautiful.

Mrs. Tere is happily married to Elpidio who's thirty-six years old and with whom she has four children: Julio David who's sixteen years old, Litzi who's eleven years old, Cristian who's eight years old, and Enrique who's six years old.

She tells us that at times she doesn't have thread with which to work and that it makes her sad as she so enjoys her work. She feels bad when she doesn't have the resources to do what she most likes which is to makes her tapestries and tablecloths.

Mrs. Tere tells us that she is very happy with her business and that it provides her with good earnings. In this way she can give a better life to her children.

She requested the loan to buy more material to make tapestries like: white thread, silk thread, worsted thread.

She tells us that she is very happy with the foundation for supporting her so that her business grows and that in this way she can improve her quality of life.

The other members of the group are:

Inés, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Artemio, who makes a living selling chiles and seeds.
Maricela, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Aída, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Reina, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Maria Susana, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Rufina, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Demetria, who makes a living selling embroidery.
Petrona, who makes a living selling embroidery.

They are thankful to the foundation for helping people from small towns who have an engrained desire to better themselves as their town is very small and poor, but in Tetepelcingo there are hardworking people and many children that need a better future.

loans.use: to buy material to make tapestries and tablecloths.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 30-year-old salon owner in Mombasa. She also runs a cosmetics shop to supplement her income. Winnie is  married and the mother of two school-going children. She has been running her business successfully for the past four years.

This marks Winnie's first loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs and hair rollers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to purchase a piece of land to construct rental houses. Winnie hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs and hair rollers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 60 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has operated a grocery store for 3 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Rose also farms to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. Rose hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy onions, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 38-year-old retail shop owner in Mariakani. She is married and the mother of five children. Martha has been a shopkeeper for the past two years and her business is doing great.

This marks Martha's second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 42 years old and married with three children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Mildred aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 53 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Zenaida has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money to have a mini-grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 27 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 1, 4 and 5. She invested in a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business to help provide for her family's needs. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. She requested a loan to pay for registration and buy spare parts. Cristy hopes to be a good wife and also a provider for her family.

loans.use: to pay for registration and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ma. Rodita

texts.en:
Ma. Rodita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Rodita requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soft drinks, curls, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Ma. Rodita would like to save enough money to start another business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soft drinks, curls, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Migcanaway in Tangub City. She is 35 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she raises fish for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for this activity. 

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair fishing nets.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Arlyn requested a 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy assorted material for her tailoring business.

Arlyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 38 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy parts and other accessories for her motorcycle.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy parts and other accessories and for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Garang, Tangub City. She is 22 years old. Edna is single. To make a living, Edna raises fish for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, 34, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhung and her husband have been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 38 years old. He owns a food stall in Mariakani. He is  married. His business has been in operation for the past three years, successfully.
 
This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Sherly works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Sherly is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, detergent, and other groceries to sell.

Sherly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to have a mini grocery at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, spices, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 32 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, spices, shampoo, toothpaste, etc.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. He is 37 years old and married. To make a living, Julito raises pigs for sale. He has been in his business for 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Julito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy feeding supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Mriphe

texts.en: Mriphe is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to start a vegetable stall business to add to his income. With the loan, he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more profits and provide for his family.

loans.use: To start a vegetable selling busines, purchase sacks of vegetables, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 31 years old. She is the mother of three children. She is from Vihiga town and is married to Vitalis, who operates a taxi business.

Beatrice is a shopkeeper. She has been operating this business for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of 6,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy retail stock of sugar and cooking oil. Her profits will be used to provide the basic needs of her family. Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 42-year-old married woman with five children aged between 6 and 22. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth also does farming. She helps her husband grow rice crops on their farm. Elizabeth also runs a sari-sari (variety) store to help augment their family income. 

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Elizabeth hopes for this loan to help increase their business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rancho Caporal Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Rancho el Caporal" esta integrado por tres hombres y una mujer pertenecer a una comunidda muy tranquila donde la mayoria de las personas se dedicana la crianza de animales como pollos, Guajolotes, tambien se dedican a trabajar en el campo. El grupo decidio ponerle a si ya que asi le llama el lugar donde ellos viven 
Doña Adela quien es una integrante del grupo tiene 71 años de edad y es viuda por lo que esta viviendo sola en su casa aunque vive cercas de sus hijos, comenta que desde hace 15 años ella se dedica a la crianza de animales pero esta vez ha solicitado el credito para surtir su tienda ya que comprar todo lo que le hace falta para tenerla bien surtida, comprando detergentes, productos enlatados, leche, queso, azucar, huevo, pan, refrescos, etc.su tienda tiene ya trece años su tienda la tiene ubicada enfrente de un panteon por el momento no tiene nombre solo se ubica asi que esta enfrente de un panteon.
El desafio que presenta doña Adela es que tiene mucha competencia alredor y esto sele dificulta para obtener buenas ganacias, pero no se da porvencida ya que siempre terminan por cerrar.
Una meta de  doña adela es ampliar su tienda ya que esta muy cerrada y no tiene buena presentacion entre risas Adela comenta "Mi changarrito necesita una buena mano de gato para que quede presentable"
Doña Adela y el resto del grupo estan muy agradecidos por el credito atorgado por parte de KIVA Y FRAC ya que muchas veces no tienen para invertir en su actividad, pero esto les beneficiara de mucho ya que podran comprar lo que les hace falta.
Don Efren invertira en piezas piezas viejas para autos, Don Miguel comprara vacas, maiz y alimento, Don Fernando invertira en borregos.
texts.en: The "Rancho el Caporal" group consists of three men and a woman who belong to a very tranquil community where the majority of people make a living raising animals like chickens and turkeys and working in the fields. The group decided on this name because it's where group member Adela lives. She is a 71-year-old widow who lives at home by herself, although her children live close by. Adela tells us that for the past 15 years she has made a living raising animals, but at this time she is requesting the loan to stock her general store so she can buy all the products it has been lacking. She plans to purchase detergents, canned goods, milk, cheese, sugar, bread, beverages and other items. She has had her store for 13 years, and it is located in front of a cemetery. The challenges she faces is that there is a lot of competition in the surrounding area and that makes it difficult to earn good profits, but she does not give up because things always end up well. One of Adela's goals is to expand her store since it is very tight and isn't very appealing. Between laughs, Adela says "My small store needs a good makeover so it become presentable." Adela and the rest of the group is very grateful for the loan authorized by Kiva partner FRAC because a lot of times they don't have enough to invest in their activities but they will benefit a lot from this loan and be able to buy what they need. Efren plans to invest in used car parts; Miguel plans to buy cows, corn and feed; and Fernando plans to purchase sheep.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, canned goods, milk, cheese, sugar, bread, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 41 years old and married with three children. With all children in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a sari-sari (vaiety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Nora has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rebecca has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a widowed woman with 4 children, two enrolled in school. She operates a bakery and sells her goods retail. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She plans to use her loan of Ksh. 10,000 to buy sugar and cooking oil for her business. Fatuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She describes her major challenge to be price fluctuations. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is a widow from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like snacks, detergent soap, toiletries and soft drinks. She earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods and snacks. Esmaelita hopes for her business to grow more. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods and snacks.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 59 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Filipina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Filipina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, sugar, etc.

In the future, Filipina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: This time, for her ninth loan, Olivia is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos to fund her businesses of raising pigs and fishing. These businesses were previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, to continue to provide Olivia and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines (for her pigs) and fishing gear.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is a fish seller from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 45 years old and married with five children aged between 8 and 20 years old. Her husband works as a driver.

Felicisima has been selling fish for three years. She earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this business. She has applied for a loan to buy an ice box, ice, a weighing scale and more fish to sell. She hopes to earn better and be able to help sustain her children's education. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to be elevated.

loans.use: to buy an ice box, ice, a weighing scale and more fish to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 51 years old and married. He has done tailoring for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). With his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, he plans to purchase more assorted varieties of cloth for dressmaking and other knitting items.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business expansion. His future dream is to grow the business and open up job opportunities to others.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted varieties of cloth for dressmaking and other knitting items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man with two children, one in school. He operate a shop where he sells home cookware. He has been in this business for the last 5 years. His other source of income is sales of farm produce. He sells cookware both to the residents and at the market. He will use the loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase kitchen cookware for resale. He joined Yehu to access loans. Paul owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Food is his greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen cookware for resale

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of products in bulk to sell in her general store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo would like to take another loan to buy more fabric to sell in her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and clothing materials to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman with 2 children ages 14 and 18. Her husband is a rice farmer. Jocelyn is also a farmer and primarily grows vegetables to sell. Jocelyn sells her produce twice a week at her town's market and nearby towns' markets. She earns 8,000 PHP per month from this business. She requested a loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man with seven children, six of whom are enrolled in school. He operates a garage and sells spare parts. He has been in the business for the last five years. He intends to use the loan of KSH 50,000 to buy spare parts for vehicle repair at his garage. He aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Food is his greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicle repair at his garage.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine sells vegetables and fruits in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the last four years. She is 42 years old and married to Ayinea who does a retail business. They have seven children.

This will be her first loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of vegetables, fruits and potatoes to sell in her business.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to add more items to sell like cereals. In the future, Catherine hopes to establish a retail shop and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut is requesting a new loan to buy a range of basic products to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store, increasing his sales, and helping to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of basic goods to sell in his store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 43, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 20 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.
